I feel a certain kind of way about places whose doors lead immediately to the outside but this place is really clean and nice, so I’m not sure where all of the negative reviews are stemming from. Yes, it’s an older hotel, but it has been kept well and you can tell that as soon as you walk into the room. I probably should’ve taken pictures before I slept in the bed, so I apologize for that, but at least you know that the bed sleeps good! Haha! The bathroom tiles are a bit outdated, but it’s extremely clean and well kept. I have no complaints about this hotel whatsoever. I arrived
Manager Response: Thank you for the candid review! hope to see you again soon.

Summary: Excellent motel, great parking, excellent pool area, with jacuzzi. Free wine, soda and snacks from 5pm. Breakfast included. Huge room with super king bed, kitchen, dining area, makeup table etc.   Only negative was that the staff could have been a little more helpful .
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to let us know of your experience during your recent stay at our hotel. We are glad that you had a comfortable stay once more - we certainly appreciate your continued patronage and feedback. We shall look forward to having you as our guests again when you are in the Costa Mesa area.

Summary: I stayed here for a concert at Huntington Beach and club night The Triangle in Costa Mesa. For a young group it was worth the money. The room wasn’t anything special but it wasn’t poor/dirty, it worked out because I spent most of my time out and about. My rating was based on being close to The Triangle but not being crazy expensive.

Unattended children in room above running and jumping all night., No help from front office after   calling! Hotel rooms were large and clean, No ice,breakfast  was ok. Great location for this motel,but I will not be back.

I take the grandchildren here for our beach trips. Staff is very friendly and attentive, the place is clean and comfortable. Free breakfast and evening snacks with wine. Our go-to hotel in Orange county.

The bathroom was clean and the sheets were clean. I could hear the TV from another room, so bring earplugs. Good value for just a quick no-frills trip; for anything else, go to a higher ranked hotel. Fortunately, I wasn't attacked by bed bugs!

We stayed here three nights on a visit to the Newport Beach area.  We were looking for a good, clean, basic hotel.  This hotel seemed to meet those requirements.  The breakfast was quite basic for hotels of this type.  Adding a more protein to the menu would make that part better.  The bed was good. The staff was friendly.  A good power-washing of the stairs and walkways would make approaching the room slightly more appealing.  We were glad for the microwave a fridge in the room.  Wifi service was helpful and more than adequate.  The location was near to several places we need to visit while in the area.  It is about a mile or so west of the 405 and about 4-5 miles from the beach.

Reasonable price for the area. Beds are good if you like them firm. Spa is a nice touch especially at the end of the day. Breakfast is full of bread products so don’t expect much there. Maid staff always went out of their way to help make the stay more enjoyable.
Manager Response: Thank you for your recent review! We are pleased to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. We appreciate your feedback and will strive to continue to give great service. I will pass on your comments to the housekeeping staff which i'm sure would love to hear your positive comments. Thank you once again for your review!

Summary: This was a very easily accessible property. The pool was amazing! The room was good size as well. The TV was fabulous as well as the selection of channels to choose from. Overall, it was a great place to stay. I felt safe there as well, as I was traveling with my two teenage sons, only.

If one is looking for a less expensive place to stay in high price Orange County, then this place would meet their needs.  It's an older place that shows it's age; it's a bit tattered around the edges and the colors are dated.  A pleasant surprise was the whirlpool jets in the tub; I took advantage of that feature to treat an injury.  Overall, the room was clean except for the carpets.  The beds were just barely comfortable.  The location is quite good for a lot of stores and services in Costa Mesa.  I should mention that an interesting perk was the free wine served in the evening; it was wine in a box, but still.  Being located on a busy street, there was a lot of street noise earlier in the evening, but the noise level was low by the time we turned out the lights.

This is a great little place.  It is older, but still very clean and very reasonable.  The air conditioners work well, and there is a pool and hot tub available.  The staff was very pleasant and helpful; extra towels were not a problem at all.
Manager Response: Thank you for your recent review! We are pleased to hear you enjoyed our sparkling pool and the hot tub!

Summary: Great place to stay for any amount of time...breakfast could have been a little better but they do have free wine and snacks during the afternoon which is awesome...bar right on the property as well as hot tub pool and even a sauna...bunch of places to eat and shop nearby as well...great hotel overall
Manager Response: Thank you for your recent review! We are glad to hear you enjoyed your stay with us! We hope to see you again.

Summary Heading: 1.5 star hotel at pricelines 2.5 star price
Summary: what an awful flea bag.  noise problems, bathroom near check in didnt work when my 4 yr old needed to go potty, promised a king but got a queen.  rooms havent been renovated in 30 years.  i have stayed a three 2.0 star hotels recently in Orange County and all are much nicer (motel 6, quinta, best western)
Manager Response: We regret to hear the issues you encountered with your stay at our hotel. We do apologize for the lobby restroom being out of service at the time of your arrival. It is in the process of being repair at this moment. Once again we do apologize for any inconveniences this has caused you. Thank you for your recent review.

Summary: Nicole is the best! She was very professional and took great care of us! I accidentally booked a smoking room and arrived earlier than the check in time and she made sure I got a non smoking room and in our room as soon as possible. The room was very clean and spacious. I would definitely stay here again! Thanks Nicole!
Manager Response: Thank you for your recent review! We are happy to hear you enjoyed your stay with us! We do hope to see you again real soon!

Summary Heading: Dont listen to the negative reviews, this place is awesome !!!
Summary: How can people give this place negative reviews ? Seriously ? It's by far the best Super 8 I've stayed in = huge room, very clean, massive TV with tons of cable channels, great pool area, friendly front desk staff, comfy bedding, superb WIFI connection, upgraded bathroom and shower, very very comfortable bed !  This place was faultless !  Breakfast was abundant and delicious, the space and counters were spotlessly clean.  Great coffee, loved the waffles, peanut butter, and cream cheese not found at other Super 8 locations.  A superb stay, well done to all we'll def be back. 10/10 !!
Manager Response: Thank you for your recent review! We are glad you enjoyed your stay with us! We hope to see you again real soon.

Summary: Happened to be assigned the room above their laundry, operated 24 hours even past midnight. Noisy and vibration. Strongly recommended to avoid the room 201.
Manager Response: Thank you for your recent review. We regret to hear the issue you encountered while stay with us. We are currently working on a plan to have all laundry done before a certain time so that we may not disturb any guests. We do apologize for the inconvenience this has caused you.

Summary: Absolutely filthy. We couldn’t even stay after we checked in, we saw the room. Full of cat/dog stains. Extreme animal urine smell. I agreed in my check in to not allow pets, yet we had to leave because of my allergies. They wouldn’t refund me either.
Manager Response: We regret to hear our hotel was not up to your expectations. Currently our housekeeping team is under review for the situation that occurred when you checked in. We do apologize for the inconveniences this has caused you. If you could please contact the hotel so that we are able to make it right.

Summary: Loved this Place was really surprised ! The staff was great! comfortable beds.would stay here again
Manager Response: Thank you for your recent review! We are happy to hear you enjoyed your stay with us. We hope to see you again in the near future.

Summary: Have stayed at this property several times now, and have no major complaints other than the room quality being a little subpar.  But given the price point, it is not a bad value if you're looking for a room just to sleep in and not spend a lot of time.
Manager Response: Thank you for your recent review. We appreciate  the feedback. We are currently remodeling our rooms. Fresh paint, new comforter, beds and new bathroom fixtures. We hope you will return to our property to see the changes we have made! Once again Thank you for your recent review.

Summary Heading: I liked just about everything about the room. Nice set up...
Summary: I liked just about everything about the room. Nice set up with a couch, nice decor but beds were fairly uncomfortable and I woke up with my back hurting. Other than that, I had a great stay.
Manager Response: Thank you for your recent review! We are glad you enjoyed your stay with us. We do hope to see you again in the near future.

Summary: Arrived at location around 4:30 pm, checked in by a disinterested woman that smelled like cigarettes, but was unable to enter room due to it not being ready. Had to wait outside for over 30 minutes while they made their room service rounds. This location had an adjustable bed which I thought was pretty cool until I tried to sleep on it. There was a little gap in the middle of the bed separating the left and right side. No matter what setting I would put it on, they would not be even. The drain stopper for the whirlpool tub did not work, could not use it. Room had an oil smell to it.

Summary Heading: Our room was Okay. The desk clerk who checked us in was...
Summary: Our room was Okay. The desk clerk who checked us in was extremely helpful and friendly. The person before her put forth minimal effort when we arrived early and inquired about a delivery we were expecting. The electrical set up was terrible and it was a challenge to connect my medical device to power. The highlight of the stay was the friendly desk clerk. The motel needs to be updated.
The room was bigger than I thought it would be. Everything was great and was just down the street from Catalina boarding so it worked out perfectly

I read some bad reviews but the price was great for a two night stay.  I arrived at 230 pm and was greeted quickly and check in was fast. When i got to my room it was a mess. Went back to the front desk and they gave me another room that was roomy, clean and comfortable.  I enjoyed my stay. Great location and quiet.
Very happy with the price and location... Very spacious rooms. Plenty of parking and great location... Would definitely stay again...

Basic room with unexpected perks. Happy Hour with drinks and snacks, including wine, every night. Continental breakfast included cereal, toast/bagels, Instant oatmeal, muffins, packaged cinnamon rolls with a microwave to heat things up. We choose to make waffles in the waffle maker. Whirlpool tub was a nice surprise. Easy check-in/out. Area felt safe.
The room was clean and relaxing. I was given a recommendation to stay here and it was well worth it! I’m definitely coming back when possible

I stay frequently here and it is definitely the best quality at this price point. This time some jerk with a diesel pickup truck warmed the truck for at least ten minutes including revving it up. Very noisy and I would have gone outside to rag on him if it wasn't so COLD!!

Facility a little dated but much nicer than previous Super motels we stayed in years ago. This location is on a busy street but the jungle-like landscaping was lush and gave a feeling of seclusion. Room was good size.  Wouldn't have minded a little table with 2 chairs. Happy there was a clock in the room. Bathroom tub to shower conversion a little odd looking and slippery tile where it pitched steeply to drain. Shower-head height good for shorter people. Bathroom exhaust fan on its last leg; otherwise everything worked. Evening clerk struggled a little with multitasking, morning clerk delightfully friendly. Good value for money. We would stay again.
Lots of goodness for the money. Happy hour from 5 to 8 with wine, soft drinks, and snacks. Continental breakfast. Room is comfortable. Refrigerator in room. Fast and easy WiFi.
Close to the freeway, beach and mall. Good place to arrange a couple nights for small business trip. good price for the amenities

The motel didn't seem that busy, but they were unable to give me a room before the 3pm check in time. The first room they gave me had not yet been cleaned, so that was awesome. The second room had been cleaned, but there was noticeable dust on the vent covers in the bathroom and on the nightstand. I'm not a neat freak, but I wiped the vent covers myself because it was so obvious. The shower had a hose with a sprayer attached to the regular shower head, but no mechanism anywhere that would divert the water flow. The plates that connected the shower head to the wall were extremely rusty. There was no liner to the window curtain, so no way to let in light without being on display. Continental breakfast was minimal, and you had to walk outside across the parking lot to get to it.

Keep in mind that I normally stay at 4 and 5 star hotels but I was trying to save money since I was only staying for an overnight and had to come in late and leave super early.  It was clean and that was the best part. The bed was so-so in comfort level and the front desk was nice enough. The original room I was given had guys in a van loitering outside and the guy tried to strike up a conversation with me, and even asked if I would "do him a favor" and leave the room propped open if I was checking out (he saw me go in and out as I didn't feel safe in the room on the ground floor knowing they were outside).  The guy at the front desk nicely gave me a new room, though he didn't have a lot of empathy or seem to care that the guys were there. The woman at the front desk was quick
Friendly front desk employee, he was very informative and excellent customer experience. The hotel was very clean and easy to find everything inside. Will be comin soon when I come around this area!
Was satisfied with our stay, for the cost. We arrived at mid-day, but could not check it because check-in wasn't until 3. But that was fine, we just went exploring. When we returned, room was ready.

It had been several years since I had stayed at this property and what a pleasant surprise!!! They had remodeled the rooms and it was as if I were in a 5 star for the most part.  Really nice work center... comfortable accomodations and nothing to complain about.  When I come back to the coast... Super 8 Costa Mesa is my only choice!!!

Right when we got there the lady at the front desk came out with a terrible attitude, she was huffing and puffing and seemed super annoyed at the fact that she even had customers, she was so rude she was even rolling her eyes and shaking her head, and made me repeat myself 3 times simply asking to check in, as if I had some ridiculous request, or as if I was stupid, even as we pulled away she gave us a dirty look.. it really turned me off to the hotel immediately. Other than that the rooms were fine, but for some reason they don’t provide conditioner?? at ALL. so make sure to bring your own.
The motel was clean and very welcoming. Love that they have snack time and free breakfast and how close to all the stores.
It was OK to my family. The location is fine. I like the bathroom but did not like the smell in the room.

Staff are exceptional and make you feel always valuable. they have nice breakfast and happy hour served for free. the only reason I gave them 3 out of 5 is that the room was never cleaned as expected, I once touched the carpet with my hand and hit a broken glass that made me bleed a lot, there was also food remaining on the carpet every where, not to forget the insects and bad smell near the sink. they really need to improve on cleanness.

Waa a little apprehensive at first since I have never stayed at a Super 8, but was pleasantly surprised given the price I paid.  Everything was decent except the bed, which was a little mushy.  But everything else -- room size and temp control, bathroom, cable tv, quietness, and refrigerator in the room -- was a thumbs up.

The property was clean and quiet. Close to everything you could want on vacation the pool and jacuzzi were in full operation I went in both. They had breakfast and coffee, snacks and drinks in the afternoon. Very enjoyable stay.

I don't know if all Super 8's are as good as this one, but I was blown away by this location. It's not what you would expect from a 2 1/2 star location. The one aspect that really sets them apart in this group is customer service. Every employee I encountered really made an effort to be hospitable which is rare in this industry until you get into the top end hotels and even then it isn't always true. Most people know what to expect from a Hotel 6, but if a Hotel 6 has a six rating, Super 8 by comparison gets a Ten!  The rooms were better than expected, they could be updated and cleaner, but they come well equipped with a couch, cable TV, Wifi, refrigerator and microwave. Even the bathrooms were good with riled up shower.tub and great water pressure. There is a breakfast buffet,

Why do I stay at the Super 8?  It's not beautiful, but it is always bedbug free, clean and reasonably priced; also usually within easy access of whatever place of business or pleasure that you are travelling to enjoy.  Oh, and this one had a Starbucks within walking distance.  Bonus.

Summary Heading: Very nice motel for the value!!!
Summary: I am a frequent flyer here and have NEVER had a negative experience!!!  The place is clean and well-kept despite the PIG guests. The housekeepers do a great job and are cheerful! TIP's appreciated!!! Joanna and Edwin provide great management!!! Don't forget to walk to a delightful cafe nearby called "turnip Rose" The 1/2 Cashew chicken salad croissant paired with the "Hong Kong Crunch Salad (w/side like a baguette) is YUM-YUM

The hotel is conveniently located near the center of Costa Mesa.  Service was good.  The room was clean, comfortable and very spacious.  There is plenty of free parking.  Free breakfast and afternoon snacks.

We were excited for the weekend getaway. The room, however, was not the best for that price.  The bed seemed clean, but just about everything else looked as if it hadn't been cleaned for a while. The microwave was filthy and didn't operate properly. Because the bottom didn't rotate properly everything we tried to heat burned.  The desk and vanity area were sticky and visibly dirty. The bathroom door didn't latch so it could only be pulled closed. Luckily with just two of us in the room it wasn't a big issue. We aren't much on complaining to the staff so we just dealt with the issues and didn't let it ruin our time away. This hotel did have the absolute best internet service we have ever had on a trip! A definite plus for us.

Summary Heading: Cigarette smell smell in rooms. Not clean.
Summary: Who still allows cigarettes in hotel rooms!? This property was dirty and felt unsafe. Dirty room. Hard mattress. Cigarette burns in hotel blanket. Room 232.

I like this Super 8 because it was clean, with new paint and the management is TRYING to make it a little classier with "evening wine and chips" and "free breakfast".   A lake was forming at 7am in the parking lot from sprinkler runoff.  GOOD:  New TV, clean bed and clean carpet.  BAD:  Renovations are cheap-looking.  Air conditioning or heater does NOT work.  Coffee grinds in our morning coffee.

I was really surprised at this super 8. The lobby was cute and had free breakfast, and wine, soda, and snacks for a period of time. The front desk was kind and made check in easy. The hotel room and bathroom shower were very spacious and clean. Would definitely stay here again.

Summary Heading: Great for near beach / LA getaway
Summary: Visited with friends and needed a cheap spot that was somewhat close to the beach, as well as Los Angeles. This Super 8 was a great option for us. Good hotel breakfast, nice room and atmosphere. Would stay again

Summary Heading: This was one of the largest size rooms I have stayed in...
Summary: This was one of the largest size rooms I have stayed in under the super 8 brand. The riom was nice. I will say the carpet needed cleaned as proof of what our socks looked like after walking on it but the place did not smell or look dirty. The breakfast at super 8 is always refreshing and this one was just a basic breakfast but well supplied and a clean bfast room. The staff was friendly. I did not use Wi-Fi and didn't ask or notice if it was available.

The room was nice and clean. It was not too bad in the room but there was a random fire alarm at Midnight that forced everyone to wake up and the morning after someone's suitcase was stolen from their car. Breakfast was alright. If I had to recommend this place to someone, the price should be lower to stay in a room like this.

We were visiting family nearby and just needed the beds to sleep in.  Check in was just a bit slow as there was an issue with the people in front of us.  Other than that we found the hotel to be in great condition, clean, with plenty of room, 2 queen comfy beds a fridge and microwave. The lobby offered afternoon snacks, a waffle,cereal and fruit breakfast (we only needed the coffee), a pool, and the area of town felt safe. There was nothing upscale about this hotel but that is what we wanted, I would definitely stay here again.  A nice surprise!

We were visiting Costa Mesa for our daughter's wedding which was to held just several miles away so this location was perfect for us. The property was clean, the staff personable and breakfast met our needs.

Upon arrival check-in was very easy and quick. The room was very spacious more than enough room for three people even had a kitchenette. Breakfast was pretty good,great location to the beach. Pool/spa was very refreshing, and staff was very friendly. I will come back.

The beds in the room were uncomfortable and the bedding threadbare. This is a dated motel. While we were there, there were men in the car-park talking loudly until 1 am in the morning. There was no on-site security so this place did not feel safe!

I arrived in town late for an appointment and decided to stay overnight.  Front desk was very helpful in getting me a ground floor room, which was clean, spacious, and bed was very comfy.  Free breakfast the next morning was abundant with many choices.  Lovely courtyard and trees with pool in courtyard. Very pleased with the speed of the free wifi, too.  Cleaning staff took the time for extra little touches, like folding the tissues and bath towels into fancy fan shapes  nice touch!

This was a very pleasant surprise! First time staying at a Super 8 and will not be the last. Staff were very courteous and helpful. Beds comfortable and the room was clean. Loved the extras like complimentary wine, soda and snacks in the evening and the salt water pool was wonderful!
A very nice clean and good priced place, the breakfast was a nice bonus,plus we liked the free wine and snacks at 5:00 pm,staff where very friendly.

Summary Heading: first time OC fair with my elderly parents
Summary: Looked like we were the first ones to arrive at the 3pm check in time, but a minute later a couple arrived to check in, too.  The concierge was busy training a new employee and the trainee took cared of the couple behind us, but since he kept asking questions how to process the check in, the concierge left me and helped the trainee.  They got checked in first!  When it was my turn again, the 2nd room we  booked wasn't ready at check in time and I was asked if I can wait.  I was not happy because I was with my elderly parents who needed rest since we were in the heat of the OC fair for a few hours at that point.   I wish: a) The concierge trained the trainee by showing him as she was processing my booking, not leaving me and helping the trainee complete his work while neglecting

The room was clean except for the bed covers, which was immediately addressed upon my complaint. Our stay was nice, very quiet place, and shopping centers within a few miles from this place. Newport Beach was the closest and it was easy to get to.
Had a nice room with plenty of friendly service. What was nice was they shuttled us to the fair and back for free!!

This is a really nice motel in the middle of Costa Mesa.  Very quiet, lovely pool area, very clean.  Have stayed here before and it beats most of the small places.  Lots of restaurants to choose from and the beach is maybe 15 minutes away. Your off the main hwy. to beach but the noise does not carry into the rooms.  Very clean and updated rooms also.

Great say the staff was excellent and so was the room and pool it's about 15 min away from Newport Beach which is the best surf city beach and local shops . Also near Huntington as well , enjoyed our stay to the fullest the lady at the front desk she rocked she knows all the best places for people to go and see..

This is an older hotel but they keep it clean, have large room, and comfortable beds.  The grounds and rooms are well kept-up.  It is convenient to the 405 Freeway and close to shopping, restaurants and entertainment, including the beach.  Great location.  Decent hotel. Internet is spotty, so I was unable to use it for business correspondences the entire time i was there. Terrible breakfast (no proteins at all except milk for the cold cereal!) Good value for the price.
I was not  expecting a lot, but the place is way to dirty, the carpets are not even vacuum. Towels are too old, bedrooms smell bad.

First, to heap special praise on Palmera, Crystal, and Ashley of the Front Desk Staff.  I had a few problems with my room when I checked in; tub wouldn't drain, the Remote for the TV didn't quite work right, and the phone was, well, unusable. Well, after I walked down to the Office and explained the problem; it was as if they waived a magic wand.  By the time I came back later that day; everything was fixed and fixed well.  Then on the second day of my two-day stay, I asked if they could find me a room for that night, as the room I had been in was already booked.  Yep, it was magic wand time again!  But, to make matters worse for myself, I had left a special charger in the 'old' room.  Once again, the Front Desk staff to the rescue with Ashley finding that for me.  Would I stay

The motel manager was very helpful She allowed us to park our Uhaul truck on the lot when there was clearly no allocation for such a vehicle. This is bad. She was good. And in addition, the room wasn't cleaned, Super 8 stole my points from me after I used them to book a stay here. How incompetent? It's typical of the mismanagement of this motel. No communication at Wyndham rewards.

the rooms were nice in size with comfortable beds and pillows , quiet AC units, a mini fridge and a nice table with extra chair. Pool was nice but very little shallow area for smaller children. The front desk staff  nice . Breakfast adequate but when staying for a week the same thing every day got a little old. Location was good only a 5 minute walk to my daughters apt and two nice restaurants close by and a 7-11 for odds and ends just minutes from room.

the 'net never did work, and i heard some of the lamest excuses i had ever heard from the office, such as"it does not work at my house either".  most hotels have such reliable internet anymore that i stopped bringing my backup mi-fi units.    overall, a decent enough place (but why a murphy-bed in the room??)  -- but not having internet let us in a very difficult situation.   if the electricity was off, the hotel would have acted on that, but obviously not the net.

When we got there, the room had a funk to it.  Like old cigarette smoke, cheap booze and sweat.  The "recliner" was stiff and uncomfortable to sit in, the beds were springy and the linens, although clean, were cheap.  When we called the front desk and asked them to please bring up some air freshener, we were completely ignored.  On the plus side, they had a nice flat screen, a mini fridge, and the wifi reception was good.  Unfortunately, I will not be staying at this hotel again.

Summary Heading: Great Location - That is about it
Summary: I got to the hotel a little early (12:30p or so) and they said that checkin was at 3pm.   Not a big deal, I ask when the room would be ready and they asked to check back at 230.  We had driven through the night so that was mildly annoying but we dealt with it.  Came back at 230, one room was ready, the other hadn't been cleaned yet.  Housekeeping ran and changed the sheets and we apparently were good to go.  Still ended up not being able to check in until after 3pm due to this, which is ridiculous being that they knew we were waiting they could have prioritized the cleaning.  Room itself was serviceable.  Area was sketchy, in the hotel parking lot.  People sitting with their doors open, random people sitting in the parking lot etc.  If I end up going back to that area I'll find

Summary Heading: Great Facilities....POOR INTERNET CONNECT AND SPEED
Summary: I have been staying here for 2 yrs. Each visit I am guaranteed by staff  that the internet connect was updated and satisfactory.  WRONG!!! If you must conduct business affairs online from your room... DO NOT STAY HERE.  YOU WILL BE FRUSTRATED. I have been more than patient and NOTHING was done to cure situation. They have lost my business.
Not glamorous, but very comfortable. Comfy bed and very clean inside and out.  Jacuzzi was perfect after a long day on your feet. Will book again next trip

our room was comfortable enough (not sure why there was a murphy bed in our room).  good location for walking to the fair.  the internet was beyond horrible.  the front desk people told me it was not working for some time, and one even told me it didn't work where she lived either.  funny thing, i was sort of used to this a couple of years ago, but in the new modern era, hotels take internet MUCH more seriously, so much so that i stopped bringing my backup mi-fi units.  if the electricity was off, the hotel would get it fixed (or offer refunds).  if the water was off, same.  if the sewer was not working, the hotel would take that seriously.  so why treat the internet like its nothing but a broken ice machine??

I booked this room through price line.  The pictures of the property looked updated and my perception was good.   It looked clean and a good location. Check in was somewhat difficult, they gave me a smoking room when I requested a non-smoking room. The room it self was unacceptable, I checked the bed and towels to make sure they were clean and found hair on both. I took pictures and went down to the front desk and showed the front office staff.  I was offered another room which I accepted and they remade the new room with new linen.  I went and rechecked the linen and towels and found more hair on the bedspread.  The room had a damp, strong urine odor. Spider and ant problems.  No Laundry facility.  For the 2 and 1/2 days we stayed it was another bad experience.  I will not be

We found the unit to be clean, with extras that we didn't expect.  The management was friendly and very helpful.  The bed was not comfortable for me.  The unit was back off the street and so we didn't hear the street noise.

Overall was a very pleasant esperience very clean, next time I would like to see a more friendly face. She was nice and helpful but she look angry all the time. Rooms are very clean a really good price.

The  staff at this Super 8 were very friendly and the  complementary breakfast is completely awesome. The location is only 5.5 miles from Huntington Beach and many other beaches. There are lots of restaurants very close by. The bed was very uncomfortable though and the pillow is small and lumpy. I could hear all noises outside the room and there's a gap in The door and cigarette smoke leaked into my room. But the price was so affordable that made it worth it.
Was a very comfortable stay, Very quite , breakfast   was  awesome  with the kids, cocktail  hour for us Grandparents  was good.. kids love the snake..looking forward to the next stay..

this hotel was convienantly located for our whale watching tour in Newport Beach.  Cost effective for a family on a budget.  The accommodations were simple but clean and comfortable.  Not the best of roadside appeal but served the purpose and met our needs.  Continental breakfast was nice especially the waffle maker.

We were traveling the beaches of southern California, We decided on visiting my child hood neighborhood and school's to show my Son where I grew up. We had been staying in hotels on the beach, after visiting there we were headed to The Newpot beach area. I thought we would stay off the beach that night because we would arrive in the evening. And were tired. The front counter person was not to be seen , waited a few minutes then she showed up , the room smelled of cigarettes. The next morning , we went for breakfast. They had poor service when items ran out.Never again will we stsy here
Very pleased with the room and it was very very clean! Hot tub was lovely. Having a DVD player nice touch.
The bathroom had dirt build up, other people's hair. We signed agreement to not smoke but the room had ashtray and stunk
Great Hotel & Staff...Outstanding Service and Friendly Employees! Quiet, Clean and Cozy! I will most likely stay at this Hotel in the Future...

Hotel was clean and everyone was friendly. There hot tub usually has a problem with the heater so it is broken down a lot. It the fix it by the next day. The pool was nice and warm and the breakfast was excellent!

I wasn't expecting much from a Super * Motel, but figured that if Wyndham has taken over the franchise, maybe it'll be OK.  WOW, what a surprise.  This was an excellent motel.  Large room with conveniences, clean, great reception staff, and a wine happy hour.  Perfect!

This reasonably priced motel for a surprisingly nice area in Southern California was a great place.  Jessica, the front counter staff member was especially helpful in every way.  The rooms were kept clean and well maintained.  The front counter support after arrival (not including Jessica) needed additional supervision but adequate.
This was one of the better places we've stayed. The staff was very friendly and our room was very comfortable. The continental breakfast was great. Definitely would stay here again.

There was a mixup with our reservation and the staff made us feel like we were trying to 'get away with something'  After our first night stay I got a phone call from the manger telling me that i had to come to the hotel immediately and take my stuff out of the room. When I told her we had made a second reservation she still insisted we stop our visiting and come to the hotel immediately!  I asked someone to call and talk with her and then she rescinded and said we could stay in the room.  When we got there later that evening we were locked out and had to sign a form for payment.  I am sure that whole thing good have been handled more tactfully and the manager could have checked her reservations first before she approached the situation so badly.

Summary Heading: Good price and location, not fresh bed linens
Summary: Friendly staff, clean room and bathroom, breakfast is good, but furniture is very old style and therefore room itself looks not comfortable. Bed linens seemed not fresh and unwashed as there was hair on them. It was noisy a little bit outside.

Really nice room, plenty of space, big bed and tv. It even had a whirlpool tub. Which I did not get the opportunity to try. :(  After a great night sleep, we got ready to go down to breakfast. Only to see that they had run out of everything. Nobody was taking care of the eating area. I had to go to the reception area, she was on the phone so I stood there waiting. She never looked up to at me to just let me know she was aware of me being there. Finally, after about 5 min she looked up and asked what I needed. I then asked if they can restock. She looked at her watch ( it was only 9 am) and said ok. And continued with her phone call. Waited, she never got off the phone. We finally just left hungry. Several things could have been done to make sure the phone call and we were taken

This motel definitely was a nice stay. There is ample parking and the property is fairly small and easy to get around. There is a pub right next door and they have cheap drinks and a comfortable atmosphere.   Being a beach town, there are wet suits and bathing suits thrown all over the place to dry off, so the stale salt water and body odor smells that permeated throughout the property was a little off putting when they're right there as you walk in and out of your room.   The breakfast was very disappointing. They offer it until 10am and even though we arrived a little before 9, there was no waffle batter left and no milk left. And no one there to tend to the replenishment. We asked the lady at the front desk, but was too busy on the phone to even acknowledge we were looking

Summary Heading: Good value for a minimal price.
Summary: It was fine for our purposes. Had a convention in the area and this was a cheaper option then staying onsite.

Summary Heading: Poor service, no internet. Worrest roomd
Summary: Poor service no internet, they charged extra money with out intimation, worrest bed, worrest bathroom, i naver recommend this motel.
This place is amazing, close to beach, restaurants, shoppi g and movie theaters. The best thing is the service that staff privides. EDWIN, the manager is amazing, always helpful. Breakfast the bimb.

Summary Heading: Nice staff, fairly clean but outdated place; breakfast wasn't much
Summary: The place needs serious updates throughout. It's so old it feels unclean, even though housekeeping does a nice job. The beds were okay, the pillows weren't bad, and the noise level wasn't too disturbing. The toiletries were minimal--shampoo and bar soap--so bring your own lotion, conditioner, etc. The breakfast was two cold cereal choices, a couple of things to toast, a waffle iron, some danish-y things, and yogurt; if you get up early enough you might get one of the two bananas set out. The pool looked rather dirty, so we didn't bother, and the hot tub...um, just no. The staff was courteous, and helpful when we had a question, or needed an extra towel. It's just kind of a cheap place, and I never felt very comfortable, so I'm not sure I would stay here again.
I had to spend only one night there but for the money i would say its a pretty nice place to stay..Poll and spa were clean as were the rooms ..

I did like the convenience of the hotel really close to the beach... only 15 min Price was affordable, it was clean... the place is little outdated but for a getaway is perfect... I will recommend this place if you are not really picky. P

My daughter and I stayed here for two nights during a southern California trip. The room was nice and big, with double sinks outside of the bathroom. The beds were comfortable and clean. The breakfast was not too exciting, but it was ok. I thought it was a good value for the location. I would stay again!

This place is not only inexpensive, but CHEAP. Room can barely be called clean, towels/sheets/bedding incredibly worn and dirty. Homeless folks, drug dealers and prostitutes hanging out in the parking lot. I could not sleep until 3 a.m. because the drug addict couple next door was verbally and physically assaulting each other. Front desk employee was very professional and well-intentioned, but could not get them to quiet down. In the end this place is not worth it. Spend a few bucks more and go someplace with peace of mind.
It was dirty, outdated furnishings, staff was unresponsive.  .Homeless people were sleeping under our first floor window, snoring and coughing all night.

Summary Heading: Gave it a second chance now we're ready to change hotels
Summary: Stayed here in December and weren't particularly pleased. Customer service has improved (same girl at reception desk). The price is very reasonable for the area but we're ready to change hotels and spend a bit more. The room was clean but the carpet had many visible stains. They have coffee in the room, a refrigerator, breakfast with waffles and the typical amenities . The food in the breakfast area was kept refreshed, as compared to our last visit, but the counter was in need of cleaning and the tables were left dirty and sticky even though there was no one in the breakfast room. Summary Heading: Great value for the price and area
Summary: We enjoyed our stay with our little family. It is in a good area and very quiet. The rooms are old and not squeaky clean, but that was expected.

We decided to stay after visiting Catalina, and randomly pulled the Super 8 out of the internet. We were pleasantly surprised by the friendliness of the front desk team, the "suite" we had, and the price! We will galdly come back!
Older but fairly comfortable room. Average for cleanliness and the breakfast selection was below average. Great value for the area and the staff was friendly.

Summary Heading: Room was much nicer than expected, spacious and quiet.  Had...
Summary: Room was much nicer than expected, spacious and quiet.  Had a couple of problems that were taken care of very promptly.  Employees very friendly and helpful.  Will definitely stay here again.

The facility is very old and tired, needs updating from the 80's. The gentleman that took care of us checking in made the trip wonderful with his attitude and kindness. The world is a better place with people such as Edwin part of it.

Stayed here for my sons basketball tournament.  Was pleasantly lean and the staff very friendly.  Breakfast was just enough variety but maybe more protein options and more bananas.  They ran out quickly.  Great value

We have stayed here many times. In the past I was told to call the hotel the morning of our stay to request an downstairs room, which I did and was assured of one. When we arrived, I was told no downstairs room was available and "We're all booked." This was done without our knowledge and was not OK. I'm not sure if we will be back if I can't trust them to do what they promise. On the plus side, Palmira was very friendly and helpful, even though she could not do anything about our situation.

Summary Heading: Great value for the price! Honest staff!
Summary: The staff was friendly and courteous. We were later than expected and they were so accommodating. We left important stuff behind and they turned it into the office for us! We will definitely stay again! Our kids loved the pool and spa! No one wanted to leave!

Summary Heading: Yes, we will stay again, and again, and again!!!
Summary: We have stayed at other hotels in the area and this stay was over the top!  Easy, friendly check-in, very clean room (bath area was VERY nice), beds were comfortable and the room was nicely appointed.  Breakfast hours are great (6-10am) and the presentation, quality, amount and taste of everything was fantastic.  Staff was outstanding!  We have already booked another stay.

The hotel room was clean and a/c worked well. Big tv, refrigerator, clean bathroom, clean bed. It's nothing fancy but it's good if you only plan on sleeping there. Only thing is the wifi either doesn't work or they don't give you clear instructions on how to use it. Also, no plugs next to the bed to charge your phone. But I'd stay there again.

My trip was not your average simple trip, and the staff made it very easy to get checked in and accommodate all of my needs. I thought I was going to have a lot of delays, but they made it happen for me. Thank you...

We had a very enjoyable stay at the Super 8 in Costa Mesa. The rooms were clean, very friendly service and a nice breakfast each morning. The location was very close to everything we were interested in. The pool and hot tub were clean and nice. The price was reasonable especially for the area. We would stay there again!

Love, Love, Love this hidden gem! Hotel room is clean, big, and the bed is comfortable. The location is perfect for us. Very convenient.   Also has a wine happy hour plus a great breakfast spread. I highly recommend this place.

Summary Heading: Pleasant, but still a few things that can be improved
Summary: I was really surprised by how nice the room looked at first glance. I didn't have any problems with neighbors making too much noise, which is good. The flat screen TV was nice and having HBO was great. Although I didn't use it, I appreciated that there was a whirlpool tub. And pretty much the basic accommodations were satisfying.   However, some improvements could be made over time. The mirror over the bathroom sink is ridiculous. There were two separate mirrors covering the wall, but there was a huge gap of space between the mirrors in the center, and with the sink being in the center of the counter, you'd have to move to the left or right of the sink to see yourself in the mirror. It didn't make sense. It should really be one mirror in the center, unless you plan on having two

The hotel was a good value for the money paid.  Only issue encountered was that I found the check in person had billed my VISA card for the room we had already paid for prior to check in.  The mistake was corrected when I brought it to their attention.  The bed was comfortable which was great.  Breakfast was satisfactory but a little variety would be good.  Front desk staff was always friendly.
semi  clean rooms.  i found a pair of socks that weren't mine, and the maid left a rag for 2 days. a few times they didn't service the rooms.  loud.  it shares the parking lot with a bar.

We reserved (and paid for) a room with a jetted tub. At check-in, the woman at the desk confirmed our room would have said jetted tub. The room we got did not have a jetted tub, in fact, it didn't have a tub at all! Just a shower. So I went down to talk to the woman who had just confirmed the room had a jetted tub, and she said there was nothing she could do. The next day, I get up early to talk to the manager and she says the rooms with jetted tubs are all full because the hotel is overbooked (even though the parking lot was relatively empty throughout our entire 3 night stay) and that the online reservations are not linked to their reservation system at the hotel. I needed a room for one night and the hotel I initially booked had bad reviews, so I needed to change locations. I was coming from Disneyland and it was about a 25 minute drive to the super 8. Check in was easy, the parking lot was great, the staff was very friendly. There are plenty of food places nearby. I was so happy with the room as well. It was clean and the beds were comfortable. If I need to stay in the area again, I will stay here. I will also stay in others if they are available in the area I'm going.
Stained carpets and aged room. No iron or ironing boards (borrow it from the front desk). Phone didn't work, so had to walk up to the front desk. TV remote didn't work well.

Being dirty is not an excuse, even if there is a budget hotel . We had to stay in smoked room, because we did not have an other option. They did not display whether room is smoked or not, when there was sold. My baby had cough until the morning. We had to open the door out😣😣  Towel was very dirty Room carpet was so dirty, nobody had vacuum that was obvious, because there were some fruit seeds and needle on the room carpet. This was my first experience about super 8 and I never go any Super 8 anymore.

We have stayed there in the past and have been satisfied.  It is a very good value for the area and is located conveniently.  The breakfast wasn't up to our expectation this time, but was sufficient as a quick bite to start the day.  We would definitely stay there again, very nice and helpful staff.

The front end worker was very kind and helpful, but he was too busy - we waited 20 minutes to check in, 2 hours to get our cot.  It was too much work for one gentleman.    For how out dated the hotel is, it was over priced.  Beds weren't comfortable - they were old, same with the pillows.  The continental breakfast was ok - waffles were a hit

we wanted to stay in the costa mesa area to be close to newport beach. we were taking a ferry to catalina island the next morning and had to be at the ferry station by 8. For the location, great price and comfortable enough.
Excellent response from Staff.  Had to switch days a couple of times and they were excellent in accommodating our needs.

If you like people asking for money & cigarettes when you leave your room, drug deals & used syringes in the parking lot & people going in & out of the next room every 10-15 mins. all night long. THIS IS YOUR KIND OF PLACE.

I was taking my wife on an early whale watching cruise out of Newport Beach and needed a low cost but decent hotel room. This was a great place! We didn't get to check out the pool and hot tub because it was rainy, but we walked to the pub at the front of the property and had a drink. They gave us a list of food-delivery places so we had pizza sent to the bar! Then we relaxed in our room. We slept well and walked over to the lobby for breakfast which was filling. A little carb-heavy but most free hotel breakfasts are. Check out was simple and we were off to our adventures!

Room was great and Joanna is awesome, friendly, helpful and made everything great. Room was clean and comfortable.

The moved us next day but it also sounds like she was a known problem and they still put us in the room next to her. High traffic area with pub just across the way. Many transient people sitting on steps, up all hours. Staff was very friendly, breakfast decent. Served its purpose.

Summary: hotel clean and convenient only when I complained to front desk of another guest next door to me with  a yapping puppy as in DOG nothing was done

It was an okay experience.  Location is good.  I liked the fact that the rooms are set back from the busy Harbor Blvd.  The hotel is older and in need of a facelift, but it was clean, had all the basics, and the staff were responsive. There is a nice looking pool and Jacuzzi, whose jets did not appear to be working.  Too cold to use in January, but in other months, it would be nice.  Downside: even though I had a non-smoking room, you could smell smoke around, including marijuana.  Really? The walls are not well insulated and I was able to hear the conversation of the guest next door - all about his heart surgery and how he almost died.  Please!  The room is billed to have a recliner, uh, nope.  That is what most people call a love seat, and with no ability to elevate your feet

I stayed at this location due to the high ratings and review on Yelp and TripAdvisor.  After staying there I was pleasantly surprised by the experience for the value.  The room was clean in places that most people don't look, the staff was very, very nice and they all provided high level of service, there was more than plenty of parking and each time I was able to park right in front of my room door, the breakfast was yummy, the internet was great, there were lots of channels to choose from, the shower was hot, the beds were comfortable, everything worked and I felt safe.  The only downsides was the A/C unit was a little loud (not enough to bother me), the bathroom counter was a little low for my preference and the fridge wasn't plugged in when we arrived.  I would absolutely

No matter which company owns motels and hotels, unless they take the time to upgrade place and make it more pleasant, your  stay is just average.

Summary Heading: Comfortable and Less Expensive than Most in the Area
Summary: This hotel could get higher ratings if small things like dirty grout in the bathroom were addressed. Room noise can be bad if the neighbors are not respectful. At 4:30 am, it sounded like someone was in our room talking on the phone. We looked outside before we realized that she was in the next room. The evening was cold, so we could not set the AC unit on "fan only" for white noise, as the room temperature dropped quickly. If we chose Heat, the fan was only when heating. Breakfast was continental, but there was nothing for a gluten-free diet. Wish there had been yogurt or boiled eggs along with the wheat cereals and breads. The pool area was pretty, but no-one used it in 3 days due to the cold weather.
it was great value. and great staff.  food location and clean.  great breakfast  and snack hour.

We've stayed in this hotel many times and were quite satisfied in the past but things appear to be changing. The rooms are clean, spacious, nicely furnished and it's conveniently located. However, It seems there has been a change of staff at the desk and they not very accommodating. I reserved a king room weeks in advance and asked for a first floor (for 4 nights). We arrived at 2:15 after traveling all day and were told check in is at 3, come back later. I told the girl I was a platinum member and usually could check in a few minutes early but she told me your rooms not ready till 3. outside of hotel is fine.  inside needs works.  I stayed in room 130 and it had a smell, bed was like a rolloway bed.  it make so much tweaking noice.  bedding is old.  TV is good size.  ants in bathroom. police arrive at site at 2 am.  it was very disruptive. Please renovate renovate renovate

Summary Heading: Two TVs and a nice chair that reclines! Awesome!
Summary: We really enjoyed our stay here and were hesitant with the Irish pub being right next door, We didn't see any problems though. The rooms were very nice and clean too. Outside maintenance was also stressed although if you park too close to the bushes your car will know it by morning. The staff were very nice and served snacks and wine which is very unusual. Don't ask for help during a football game as there were many "time outs" to watch the game. A guy thing you know! We wish we could have stayed longer but there was a mix up with the online billing, us thinking we can pay for part of the visit with one card and another few days with another. NOT HAPPENING! We were then rebilled at the non-discount rate which was a real turn off. We would like to go back but have some bills on
I visit the area frequently and I always stay there. Johanna at the front desk is awesome and I enjoy the pub next door too. The service is perfect!

The front desk lady was rude. I used to check in at 12-5am without any issue, but there were 3 occassions that the lady turned me down saying they dont have any room available and it wasnt true! The third time i went i asked if she really checked and she said no, so i went to say check it for me and tell me if there were no rooms available, and sure did there were rooms available she just dont want to be interrupted on whatever she was doing and just turned me down.
Manager Response: Our apologies for what appears to be a miscommunication regarding our check-in time. Allow me to explain, as follows:  Our guaranteed check-in time is 3 PM. As part of our Housekeeping procedures, our head housekeeper is required to check all rooms that are not rented the night before, and this starts @ 9 AM.  Our night audit process starts after 5 AM, and this is when all charges (including room & tax) are posted for the business day. As such, anyone who checks in on or before 5 AM would still be charged for room & tax for the night before; if you therefore check in, as you mentioned, between 12 midnight and 5 AM, you will still be charged for the night before.   I am not sure how the previous manager (he tendered his resignation in June 2016) or the Front Desk then handled this situation, but we no longer - for lack of a better term - do it the same way. If our current staff did not fully explain the matter, I would like to request for your understanding.

Summary Heading: Grounds and style of hotels are awesome Brad was nasty hotel room need to be wiped down better with cleaner
Summary: The grounds of the hotel were beautiful, the bread with the breakfast was nasty cheap bread, hotel rooms need to be cleaned better with cleaner. Location a hotel is awesome
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to let us know of your recent experience at our hotel. Our apologies for the quality of the bread that was served during the complimetary continental breakfast. We shall also endeavor to improve our housekeeping procedures.

Summary: The room was not ready when I got there and was not the cleanest. I had to wait an hr for my room when it should of been ready at 4pm (check in is at 3pm)
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to let us know of your experience during your recent stay at our hotel. Our apologies for the delay in getting your room ready past our scheduled check-in time, and the unsatisfactory condition of your room. Rest assured that we shall be closely looking into these concerns that you raised witn our Front Desk and Housekeeping Departments.

Summary: Price cannot be beat for what you get. Rooms are clean and have fridges and coffee makers. Wine and snacks in the evening and breakfast complimentary.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to let us know of your experience during your recent stay at our hotel. We are glad our that our efforts in making our guests' stay comfortable are appreciated.

Summary: I booked this place for my mom, as she was in town for a few days and wanted to be near her friends, so we thought it would be perfect. It wasn't. It was extremely loud and the staff would not help in any way. I checked my mom out after the first night and we booked elsewhere...never again. Never.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to let us know of your Mom's experience during her recent stay at our hotel. Please accept our sincerest apologies for what transpired. I would definitely like to review this matter further with our Front Desk staff; may I therefore request if possible that you provide me with more details by getting in touch with me @ super8costamesa@gmail.com? Thank you.

Summary: The rules and restrictions are 100% different. At first I was very upset with them.  In the end Edwin the GM. Was amazing, thanks Edwin.❤ Janell
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to let us know of your experience during your recent stay at our hotel. We are glad that our efforts in making our guests' stay more comfortable are being appreciated.

Summary Heading: Don't bother reserving a particular room type
Summary: I reserved an upgraded room because I wanted a whirlpool tub. When I arrived  they assigned me a room that did not have a whirlpool tub. When I went to the front desk to complain they said there were no upgraded rooms available. When I reserve the room I paid for the upgrade. So the girl at the front desk told me to come back and talk to the manager in the morning. When I went and talk to the manager in the morning she said there was nothing they could do because there are no other rooms clean or available.  I stayed at this motel eight for three nights. I will not return

Summary Heading: Close to SNA/John Wayne Orange County Airport
Summary: First stayed here about 3-4 years ago. It was great then. Even better now. We especially like this location for its closeness to the John Wayne Airport. The room we were assigned appeared to be newly remodeled. So much so that it looked as if they had just unrolled and installed the carpet. A new Amana A/C unit too! Furniture was either new or expertly refinished. The staff really seem to care that all is as you would want it. No unusual requests on our part. We had the peace and quiet and comfort we expected.

Check in was fast and good! Staff was very friendly! Social hour was very nice and we felt very welcome. Overall the was a very nice motel and good experience. We would recommend this to anyone traveling.

We really felt bad for the gentleman that checked us in and out - he was very poorly trained -he put us in a room with 2 queens when the reservation was clearly for 1 king bed.  Took forever to get checked in and check out was not much better. There is a real safety issue with the bath tub/shower deals.  Someone put the nonslip material on the edge of the tub but the floor of the shower/tub was so slick it was scary, being 79 years old it was very concerning and unsafe.  A simple washable rubber safety bathmat would have corrected the problem.
Great price!  Loved how clean it was.  Staff was super nice.  I had no problems.  By far this Super 8 exceeded my expectations.
We left for four hours 11 to 3 and our room had not been cleaned. They never came by to do the rest of day

Tuesday morning, Sep-19 at 8:30am my wife & I entered the office for breakfast. The manager "Edwin V" was screaming at a couple female employees right at the counter, right in front of us. I emphasize the fact he was shouting at the top of his lungs. This made both my wife and myself extremely uncomfortable. Apparently, the issue was regarding incorrectly punching their time sheets. This continued for a few minutes until I approached him and asked him to stop. There were other customers in the breakfast area who had to witness this. This form of workplace harassment should not be tolerated. In all my years of traveling, and all of the businesses I've stepped foot in, I have never seen a manager treating his employees this way. It ruined my day.

Had everything I needed - walking distance to Souplantation and Sprouts, close to 99 Cents Only, 20 minutes from beach. Loved the sauna and jacuzzi and friendly smiling helpful staff. Clean room with a nice touch of "fans" for decoration. I was blessed. Wifi in room and PC and printer in lobby. Thank you Super8 for meeting your 8 promises and more!

As a place to sleep for a night it was fine, but if you're out in the OC/beach area for the first time or to celebrate a special occasion you should consider staying elsewhere.  The room was very simple and basic, and most importantly, clean.  The area right around the hotel seems to be a little "rough" but we were pleased to see a police cruiser patrolling the hotel parking area.  What was a little upsetting was that we left a new pullover top hanging in the bathroom and forgot it when we checked out.  We called the hotel the next day but was told they didn't find it.  It's always a good idea to double check everything to make sure you aren't leaving anything behind!!!

The location is good for this motel. It is in a nice area, and there is a good bar right next door. They do not accept cash here, so know that you must pay with a debit or credit card. I have mixed feelings about that - I think it is designed to keep riff-raff out, but I don't think their website says anything about that. One poor man in the lobby was given the run around because he wanted to pay cash.  The room was clean and nice enough. The WiFi worked good. Would stay there again.
Only downside is accessibility to upper levels. Great overall though! VERY spacious rooms for the price. Clean.
Stayed at Super 8 Newport Beach Sunday 9/4/16 with easy check-in and above par accommodations including spacious and modern room and will definitely return to this motel.

Comparatively inexpensive and our expectation was not high with this "budget chain of hotel".  We stayed here for our excursion to Newport Beach.  The room was large with 2 Queen beds and overall very dated decor.  But the bed was suprisingly comfy.  There were 2 sinks on the long bench at the end of the room.  The room was spacious. The motel provides snacks near the reception area.  Breakfast in the same area was good. Cereals, muffins, make your own waffle, toasts, coffee and tea. Juices. There was a small pool on site, ice machine, and soda dispenser near the pool.  No guest laundry. Toiletries was very basic.

Summary Heading: Enjoyed my stay during the fair.
Summary: Staff was super friendly and helped the several times I asked. Would definitely stay at Super 8 again.
Friendly and quick registration.  Easy access from/to freeway.  Close to major shopping centers and stores.  Quiet. Convenient breakfast. Overall, a very good deal for the cost.

Summary Heading: good location for oc fair weekend
Summary: overall the room was pretty nice, the tub was a medium size with jets. mini fridge was convenient. the receptionist was rude when we arrived early, then when we went to check in at check in time a different employee was also rude and he was trying to blame the crappy service on the women who was there in the afternoon! totally off putting, continental breakfast was ok.. there wasn't fruit or any healthy options. overall I had to rate low because of the customer service. I have a small toddler and the employees were not very accommodating and not once did they apologize for being rude.

Been here more then a handfull of times.  No mote cadh deposits was a surprise.  Still the rooms are big and the suites with recliners are very nice for the price.  The bad points..im a wyndham reeards diamond member and like most other ive encountered they did not honor early check in or free upgrades.  I upgraded and it cost me. I also used my debit card for payment like i have every time before with no problems.  I then tfied to get my girlfriend a room and they would not accept my card i had used earlier that day. All of the sudden it being prepaid was a problem. When I got upset having so many other issues like paying for upgrade and waiting til 3 to checkin, now could not get the second room,   I was told to vacate property for raising my voice or she would call police.  I

We came for a long weekend visit to California. This was a good location to use as a home base for day trips to Huntington Beach, Newport Beach and Balboa Island.   Recommend a second floor if available but there is no elevator so must be able to climb stairs.

This super 8 was perfect for our stay. We needed a place to lay our heads while we visited the fair and beaches. Check in was quick and it was the manager who checked us in and he was friendly. He explained the shuttle service to us for the OC Fair. The shuttle was a bonus! Our room was a good size, the continental breakfast was decent and the wine and chips was fun too. Nothing fancy but it was fun. The only complaint I guess I have is that our room was cleaned sooo very late in the day and we saw an occasional ant in the bathroom. Other than that it was just fine.

We were upgraded from queen bed to a king bed and suite with no extra charge. Super nice staff. My only complaint is the breakfast didn't have a huge variety. It was alright. I would have liked some yogurts and side things one could grab and go.

Summary Heading: Horrible check in process - always 20 minute wait for no good reason.
Summary: The check in process has many useless steps. And you have to stand there and wait or someone will take your spot.

Summary Heading: noisy- reserved room in March and was told at check in that...
Summary: noisy- reserved room in March and was told at check in that the type of room I wanted was not available-REALLY- after reserving 5 months in advance.

Cheap hotel so expectations were not high. We arrived after being at the beach all day to find just two towels. I had noticed a maid cart a few doors down so I asked the cleaning lady for an extra towel which triggered the interrogation. "Are you staying here?" Yes. "Did you check in yet?" Yes: "Did you call the front desk?" The whole tone was basically accusing me of trying to steal a towel. I walked away towel less to call the desk. Was then told to come down and get them myself.

Summary Heading: Why I won't come again , room smelt bad , not fresh...
Summary: Why I won't come again , room smelt bad , not fresh,  didn't ask for a smoking room guest service didn't offer any solutions

Be prepared that if you don't make reservation through them directly they will put you in a smoking room.  I made my reservation on Hotwire and even though I requested a "Non-Smoking" room I was told by desk clerk that because it was not made with them, they could put me in a smoking room.  Held hostage basically.  Room smelled like...death.  Bed was hard.  Decor had a 1977 vibe.  Avoid this Super 8.
We stay here every year for the OC Fair. They usually provide a shuttle to and from the fairgrounds. Room was spacious and clean! Whirlpool in the bathtub was a nice surprise!

Upon arrival in our room we noticed that the vacuuming between the beds wasn't the greatest, but otherwise our room and bathroom were clean. For an economy hotel, the room was kept up well and the carpets seemed newer. We appreciated having the mini-fridge and microwave, so we could take advantage of the grocery store down the street. We didn't partake in the breakfast, but it seemed to be the usual baked goods, waffle station, juices, and coffee. This hotel was conveniently located for us and we would stay here again. Only con, as with a lot of hotels, was the thin walls. So hopefully you get quiet neighbors.

I was looking for something nice, clean and inexpensive.  I was very pleased with the decor and size of the room.  The wine and chips in the evening was a nice touch along with breakfast in the morning until 10am and not the usual 9am.  I could not have been at a better place for the price.

Summary Heading: I was very pleased with my stay
Summary: I was pleased with location , staff, the room size and comfort of bed, the breakfast was also good, honestly the only thing I wasn't happy about was like the stained carpet and cleanliness of bathtub, other than that the experience was good
Edgar, the manager and staff were very knowledgeable about the area and very friendly. Made our  stay very relaxing and stress free.

Registration was slow partly because the printer was in another room.  We had a full sack of groceries apparently thrown out with the trash.  They were going to check with the maid but we never heard back.  There were also a few things the maid failed to do like leave wash cloths one day or coffee and cups another day.  I suspect she was new or untrained.

really enjoyed the stay.  Staff is friendly; I made a mistake booking and ended up with a  smoking room but was full and couldn't change but the room didn't smell bad at all; I believe the room was recently remodeled with new carpet.  The property was kept up and the pool was clean.  Stayed a couple years ago and came back and would stay again when we get back there.  I really like the Newport Beach area.
Locations was good and room was efficient.  Quick drive to Newport or Huntington and a lot of restaurants close by on the same street.

Summary Heading: I will stay at this Super 8 the next time I go.
Summary: Stayed at Super 8 in Costa Mesa and it was great!!! The room was nice & clean. They had everything they advertised Free Wi Fi, free parking, free breakfast. It was pretty quiet at night. It is located close plenty of restaurants, shopping,gas stations & the freeway & only about 6 miles from Newport Beach. The people at the front desk were really nice!! Great value for the money.

The first room we were assigned was kinda outdated and dirty and had possible bed bug remains.  They switched us to a different room that was much cleaner and up to date with no signs of bed bugs.  The location is great, but everything else...not the best.

Summary Heading: My money wasnt good enough for them.......
Summary: Even tho I'm a diamond member for Wyndham hotels, the lady up front said they accept no cash or prepaid cards, only credit/bank cards. I don't even mind leaving a cash deposit but no cash at all is accepted. She had the nerve to tell me that she did me a favor and cancelled my reservation without penalty lol whatever. It would've been nice to know this information ahead of time before completing a reservation. So my rating is based on the fact that I couldn't even get to the room cuz they turned a paying customer away. I stay at Wyndham hotels all the time but that didn't matter.

I like to stay at this "Super 8" when visiting Newport and Costa Mesa. Close to everything!! Vons, Starbucks, Soup plantation, Massage and a short 15 minute drive to the beach!!! Always clean and comfortable. Edwin at the front desk is very helpful!

The room was very spacious and the A/C worked great. The pool and spa were clean. You can tell it's on older property, but it was nice for the price. The only thing I didn't like was the guest smoking weed in the room next to me. He had his door open, so it came right outside. The smell didn't get into my room, so that was good! That's the downside to cheaper hotels, but once again, it was worth the price. I would definitely stay here again.

Decided to stay here as it had a 4/5 rating and the price was good. Don't want to re live the whole experience- so key lowlights include: - Waited 20 minutes at an unattended check in desk on arrival. - Very strong stale cigarette smell in non smoking room. Requested to swap rooms and was met with nothing but attitude. - Disgustingly dirty shower head. -Mattress quoted as queen however only a double, also sunk into the middle of the bed. When combined with horrendous pillows didn't make for a good nights sleep. - At 4.15 AM intoxicated male was attempting to force his way into room next door, despite pleas to leave her and her daughter alone. This went on for at least 15 minutes, no security presence.  Would recommend staying anywhere but here in Costa Mesa.
Room and bath very clean and good pillows.  Pool gorgeous although sadly didn't have time to try it!  Would've liked some protein at b'fast but waffles were great!

Summary Heading: One of the worst staying experience in recent years
Summary: The room I was placed has strong sell of urine, I ask for change room but the lady in front desk said that's the only room left in the rate I pay, I have to pay extra to a better room. I ask if that can spray air fresh to the room she said they done have one and no body available to get one!!!!,
The lighting was dim and my air conditioning unit was working making the room very clamy.  The toilet lid had cigarette burns and it was really uncomfortable with the small beds.

First of all, the room had white hairs on sink, 2nd, ther was no microwave in room, & wen asked for one was told I had to be ther more then 3 nites, & last, the hot tub was out of order, drained completely

Not sure if the area was really safe. The room was not clean and it had a smell when we checked in. Wi-fi was not reliable and was quite slow. The breakfast didn't have any meat or eggs. Spend your day out in the city or beach and just come back here to sleep.

One night stay. Checked in at 4 PM an hour after check-in and room wasn't cleaned after previous guest checked-out. Room smelled strongly of cigarettes. Held $100 on my credit card for a room I prepaid online for $76. 5 days later I still have not recieved my $100 back.  I know policy is 7-10 days, but always bothers me that companies have no problem taking money from our accounts directly, but not when refurning money to accounts. Not a Super 8 thing, I know.

Summary Heading: Not to bad for a motel in Costa Mesa. Cheap prices
Summary: When we called to confirm if our room was ready a man asked if there was 2 staying I said well yes and he tried charging us extra (we said 2 when we made the reservations). He then told me the lady would get written up since she did it wrong which made me scared for her, she was extremely nice unlike this gentleman.

Whenever I have the need to be in Costa Mesa I stay here.  The staff is wonderful, the rooms are spacious and comfortable, the location is excellent, and we find it very quiet even though it is located on a very busy street.

We were looking around hotels near the beach at a decent price. This place was clean and easy to find. The beach, depending where you wanted to go, was fairly close by. Would say about 10-15 min of driving on the streets. We normally stay at fancy hotels with ridiculous prices. It's surrounded by dealerships and stores. We will be definitely come back to this location.
We arrived late but received excellent service including a first floor room to accommodate our special needs.

Located in Costa Mesa so its conveniently close to Newport and Huntington beach. Nice continental breakfast. Room was very average, wasn't gross but wasn't super nice or new. Sheets were clean bathroom was ok. I would stay again when I want to hit the beach on a budget
This hotel was not in a good area. Also I didn't feel safe at all. And when I tried to get my money back they refused. I did not stay the night due to safety.

Terrible just plain terrible!  The customer service is a disgrace, I believe the clerks name is Effrain , who is terribly unprofessional. I over heard him while in the lobby checking in a customer telling him (verbatim) " it's all good homie , I don't need your ID , it's gonna be like your not even here . Just hook me up with a black and mild later and it's all good "
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you very much for your candid review of your recent stay at our hotel. Your feedback is extremely valuable to us, as we strive to improve with each and every stay. I greatly appreciate your comments about our staff customer service.  We discussed the matter with the employee concerned, and made it very clear that this behavior is not acceptable, and that we take this matter very seriously. Please feel free to contact me directly at super8costamesa@gmail.com if you would like to discuss this matter further, and perhaps afford us the opportunity to turn your experience around. It would be such a pleasure to personally welcome you back if you should be in the Costa Mesa / Newport area again in the future!  With much appreciation,  Edgar Cobian General Manager

Summary: So thankful! We arrived the day of our friends wedding and needed to get to our room a little early.  Thank goodness we were able to check in a bit early!! Room was a great value,  staff was nice!
The manager Edgar remembered us from last summer. Was happy to see us back, asked how the family was doing. Made sure the room was good.

This was the fourth time we stayed here and it was pleasant as before.  One issue at check in was that they gave me a first floor room but I've asked for the second floor room.  The lady was willing to fine a room for us that was on the second floor.  Thanks!  The beds were comfortable and the room was clean.  We always love the wine when we check in.  Checking out was a breeze.  The breakfast was a little weak but sufficient.  Wish there were eggs and sausage as well but most Super 8s usually don't have them.
