The only issue was that the internet didn't work for us.  Thanks for doing a good job, Edgar!
Love staying here. The staff is great, the manager Edgar is always awesome, goes out of his way to make u feel comfortable and welcomed.
We checked into the room and found it was dark and smelled.  The remote didn't work, the phone didn't work and the front desk ignored our complaints.  Good thing it was only one night!

Fairly convenient to Huntington and Newport Beach General Manager extremely nice and helpful. Continental breakfast. Offered snacks and beverages in the evening. Separated kitchen/sitting area with TV nice. Nice cosmetic area with good lighting. Outdoor pool ok. Maintenance staff  did not open pool at 10 and waited to do his daily cleaning/maintenance after guests were swimming. The sauna was not working. The spa (hot tub) was not turned on till guests wanted to use it and the water was cold. Black bug found crawling on desk. Housekeeping could have been better with replacing soiled linen and toilet paper daily. Items provided when asked. Rug had an odor that affected my allergies.

Summary Heading: The cops were chasing a man in the parking lot there were...
Summary: The cops were chasing a man in the parking lot there were homeless people camped out by pool area
Everything was good as always; only want to say I wish Super 8 would bring back the danish that was provided in the breakfast room in the mornings.  .
Place an rooms clean they had gd customer service  they provided a health breakfast they also provide free movies / dvds for ur family entertainment I would stay there again an recommend to others

We are very relaxed travelers and extremely easy to please.  Can't believe anyone can find anything positive to say about this motel.  We were looking for a place for one night close to the beach areas.  Our flight left Orange County at 3pm Monday, and we wanted to stay close our last night and enjoy what we could before our flight. Check-in was fine, except we were told one of our two rooms was smoking.  I did believe the entire motel was non-smoking.  They switched us to two non smoking rooms.  The walk to the rooms had cigarette receptacles everywhere.  When we opened our door, the smell of stale smoke was so strong I wasn't sure we could stay. The room looked like it hadn't been updated since maybe the 1960's.  Bedspreads were ancient, mattresses were terrible and the

Stayed one night, business trip. Staff was terrific, room clean, quiet, all amenities. Very reasonable. Mattress could have been a bit better but got a good night's sleep. Will definitely stay again if I'm in that area.
This location was for a quick overnight before leaving to the airport the following morning. Pleasant surprise of the size of the room. Over all wonderful staff and clean property.

The parking lot was a little dirty with leaves and shrub everywhere. The continetal breakfast was the bare minamal. it was hard to manuver in and out of the parking lot because of how narrow it was. The people next to my room (226) were very loud and distrubing. They were constantly yelling at their kids. The only reason why we didn't say anything is because we were worried about the kids, that how bad they were yelling. Honestly, it was a VERY tipical stay for a Super 8.
stayed three days, was there for dephtones concert,  room was clean, staff friendly, free  breakfast was great!!
Our stay was very comfortable and quiet.  The rooms have been updated, so they are clean and well kept. This property is a very good value for the area.

My only issues with this super 8 were with other patrons. The front desk was fine, the free breakfast was adequate and no issues with parking. It was just the smell of marijuana, the fighting neighbors and the 2 am wake up from people outside my door smoking.

I've stayed at the Super 8 motel in Costa Mesa California on numerous occasions. The rooms are clean, the amenities were great, and the general manager whose name is Edgar Cobain , it is one of the nicest and most accommodating GM's that I've have ever  encountered! He makes you feel like you're at home when you walk through the door! Its close to the beach, and plenty of good restaurants nearby. I highly recommend this hotel

Staff and personnel friendly and efficient.  Rooms were clean with above average accomodations for business travelers as they provided a desk with adequate lighting.  Other guests on this trip were unusually noisy both at night and very early in the morning, i.e. 4:30-5:00 a.m. showing disregard for other travelers.  Leaving/entering location in morning and arriving in evening are difficult during commuting hours.  Morning breakfast was average.

The rooms were clean. We requested a non smoking room. Our very first impression upon opening the door of our room was " pee-yew"!  It is an older motel, we understand. But in the past it, the room we had at least, was a smoking room. It had that old nicotine smell that permeates the woodwork and fixtures. Also, this is my fault, something I overlooked in the description of the motel, there was not an iron in the room. It was the first motel in years that we have been in that did not have an iron.Like I said my fault, I didn't research enough. But I thought others may like to know. We did have a different room after the initial night. It also had a smell, not necessarily old nicotine but funky none the less, it was bearable. The breakfast was toast/bagels, cereal, instant
Everything was good. The receptionist was very helpful and knowledgeable of everything. The only thing that was an issue was there was no ice in the ice machine.
We had a great stay there, the rooms were very clean, the service was very good, and the breakfast was good   We will stay there again when we visit

This was a rare occasion  that i booked a hotel with less than 3.5 star rating. Priceline rated this place as a 2.5 star hotel and charged  close to $90 and this is not a 2.5 star hotel worth that price. I arrived early and i was lucky to get the General Manager to cgeck me in. He was gracious  and got me into  a room. That was the best part. This is a budget motel on a street full of car dealerships  with no charm or character. Nothing pretty or memorable besides the handsome manager with good guest service skills. If you want a close to attractions hotel  /motel this isnt it.  Not my type of hotel, because  its a motel. No more priceline express  deals for me. I like knowing what im paying for before i pay.
The place was old but very well kept up. TV needed to be reset but fixed quickly. Good service.
I had a very good stay for this valentines weekend, the staff is very nice and helpful everything was super clean, this was my second time staying here and I will definitely keep coming back thanks
We were a weekly stay and had to check out after 28 days which was a hassle and their weekly prices were quite high! We are in the interim of moving in our permanent home!

Clean, Quiet,  A Friendly Staff, Property well maintained, pool and grounds.. Well stocked breakfast bar, and evening snacks. The management takes pride in their work and property and it shows. I will return and will recommend it to family & friends.

This Super 8 has nice clean rooms and a great location, but the most memorable thing for us was the friendly and attentive front desk staff. Mainly the manager Edgar and the most professional customer service and attention to detail we have experienced in a long time. We have, in fact, returned several times to that particular location just because of the awsome experience he and all his staff provide time and time again. Highly recommended.

Summary Heading: Perfect place for one night or a week!
Summary: Costa Mesa is a city designed for the automobile: wide expressways run between the major sites, secondary roads have lots of lanes for travel & turning, and strip malls with lots of business chains are ubiquitous. Thus, it is no surprise that this chain motel is right on a major road, near an expressway, and surrounded by other chain businesses of every kind. Despite -- or maybe because of -- this excess of concrete, this place gives a lot of value for a great price.  This lodging is less than fifteen minutes from Orange County Airport, aka SNA, aka Santa Ana Airport, aka John Wayne Airport. The 405 Expressway is nearby, Newport Beach is just down the road, and innumerable dining options are within blocks of this place. Be careful when pulling out of the parking lot,

I'd rather stay at a motel rather than a hotel and expect the motel to have typical motel characteristics. I believe those characteristics give the motel character. This particular Super 8 has lots of character. Characters too and the staff is nice. I even had the pleasure of taking a photo of some playful squirrels atop my cars rear tire, parked of course. I like squirrels and the Super 8. Even the squirrels like staying there, and humans over age 21.
Room had a funky musty smell. Needed some updating. Personal was very friendly. Needed to know area better.
Edgar is the store manager and I only stay here because he's grrreat. Very efficient, fun and most importantly he's dependable. Thanks Edgar you rock

Summary Heading: Love the Super 8 and ALL of the staff!!!
Summary: A great place to stay...everyone is very nice and courteous...and helpful. The rooms are clean and so are the grounds. I give this place an 11 on a scale of 1-10

Eddie the Manager was so congenial, professional, humble and just plain terrific.  His first comment when he saw my outfit was "We love cowboys!" I had been rodeoing in Vegas and came in a bit sore and he was able to change me to a downstairs room close to the hot tub.....THAT MEANT SOO MUCH FOR THIS GUY. Keep up the great work.  I come into Orange County often and I will book my next stay right there in Costa Mesa.

Room was average and outdated. Shower sucked and the button was broken. Internet was slow and cut out alot. Bed was hard. Walls were thin so you could hear your neighbors on both sides. People talked outside my room all night long. Heater didn't always kick on so cool air would come in and the room was drafty. Pool was warm and the hot tub was nice. But that was about it. Don't stay here if you want quiet.
the breakfast was good the location on a main road wifi good room clean and comfortable good service

This Super 8 is convenient to everything.  The rooms are what you'd expect from a very well run Super 8.  Very nice and a value.  But the staff...they're over the top great!   Edgar at the front desk is one of the best Super 8 desk-persons I've had the pleasure of dealing with, and, the service women...(all cute) were great to deal with and very accommodating.  Please tip them well!

Summary Heading: Comfort Stay - One of the best
Summary: I was on a business trip to Huntington Beach. Friendly staff, great hospitality! Nice clean room, quiet and got a good night sleep. Stayed at this same brand hotel in many different places, for me, this subject hotel by far is one of the best hotels. Enjoyed the stay! Great value for the bucks!

Per the e-mail confirmation that I received from the hotel, check in started at 2pm. We arrived around 4:30pm and the room had not been cleaned whatsoever. The cleaning crew frantically went about cleaning the room, to which I told them to take their time as I didn't want them to rush and not to an adequate job. In the meantime I went to the the front office to talk to someone about this issue. No one was there. I rang the bell. No one replied. I ended up waiting 10 minutes for anyone to finally arrive at the front desk to help me. I then complained, and the attendant there apologized and said that they would make it up to me on my bill at check-out = which they never did. They said that they could take off maybe $25 off my bill, and that I would receive an e-mail notification

The staff was very helpful even if he was there exceptionally to help as the regular receptionnist left without notice.He had also few words to support France after the terrible attacks (not so usual). the room was clean may be need some refsreshment but nothing indecent. Breakfast was good in a real breakfast place, with usa today. Good location close to many places for dinner and shops. The top is the hello from the completely not shy squirrels in the morning... Did they expected some food?...
I love this hotel. Edgar, Will, Kelly, and the new edition Kevin are the sweetest most caring ppl in all OC. Thanks

this hotel is relatively well maintained. our stay was quiet and comfortable. we stayed here because it was close to where we needed to be and it had smoking rooms.   we have stayed at many super 8's and Days's Inn and this property was better than most . We would reccomend this property.

This hotel is a great value for the money. However, depending on the other guests, it can be noisy. I was on the bottom floor, right next to the pub and I could hear their machinery all night long and the people upstairs were up all night, tromping around. Had to call the front desk twice to finally get them to quiet down.

I was very happy with my choice of this hotel.  Clean and convenient to everything. The only problem we had was a loud party in the pool area that went on till 12:30 am when the pool was supposed to be closed at 10.  Of course it was directly in front of my door.  Other than that it was great.
Phone was broken, not even to call front desk did have to use my phone for that - I need toot paste and not found any on the room neither for sale at front desk.

Summary Heading: Exactly what we were looking for
Summary: We had a lovely time at this hotel. The room was outdated but very clean. All the staff was helpful and the parking close. We actually decided to stay an extra night since we were so pleased. There'a 15% AAA discount and free breakfast. Never went in the pool or hot tub but it looked nice.
Nice room; excellent front desk personnel.  Only problem was pathetic water pressure in shower.

Summary Heading: This is a nice place and the staff is very friendly. I...
Summary: This is a nice place and the staff is very friendly. I stayed once for pleasure but now for business. Nice morning breakfast and always has happy hour, wine, soda and munchies. Not the Ritz but I got an excellent rom rate!!!

The receptionist was top of the class. The reception room kind of had an unwelcoming smell. The same unwelcoming smell was also with the rooms. I had foreign hair on my hair when I woke up and wondered if my bedding were even changed before I got there. The break fast was not Continental as they claim it to be. I have seen really Good Continental ones in other hotels. Overall the People were the best  of the best in communicating with customers such as me.

The room was bigger and spacious then I thought it would be.  It was clean and besides a full bed it had a nice recliner that seated two people.  The staff at the front desk were very courteous and friendly.  This was a last minute trip and was only about four miles from Newport Beach.  I would definitely stay here again and also recommend it to those who don't require a luxury hotel.

It was nice to find a motel with good parking and facilities. It was a little out and proved necessary to drive in order to find a good meal. However it was lovely to have a swim and Sauna and spa which is quite the exception. The rooms were good and the staff were very helpful as we wanted to change from a smoking to a non smoking because one of us does and one not. They were very helpful. The breakfast was also very good and w reasonable choice available.

This was our second stay in 2015. Again for 2 nights. Rooms are clean and spacious equiped with refrigerator. Interior somewhat dated. Free hot breakfast (waffles). Conveniently located near freeway. Friendly staff. Nice pool and hot tub. Altough  an Irish Pub is located near the motel entrance,  no disturbance noticed. W Good value for money. Will come again.

We booked a room with a hot tub in the room. When we arrive we were given a different room and told that we could be moved to the correct room the next day if we talked to the manager.  When we went to the counter the next day we were told that the manager was unavailable but we could be moved for a $40 per day increase in rate. When we asked to speak to the manager  The young man call spoke to the manager and then hung up and told us that the manager also said we could be moved for $40 per day increase and that we could not talk to him that was his final answer.

Summary Heading: Great location, easy access to airport & beach
Summary: We took a chance on this hotel for its location & price, and because it was a member of the Wyndham chain.  We were very pleased.  Room was spacious, clean, as were the premises, the breakfast was substantial and our 3-day stay pleasant.

Asked for extra towels several times they never came. Maid service turned off the AC in 98 degree weather came back to a sweltering room after being in the sun all day. Over all my stay was pleaseant.
The staff was awesome. Very friendly and helpful. The rooms were very clean and comfy. I will definitely stay here every time I'm in the area.

Started staying here about four years ago and all was good. Now the house keeping leaves something to be desired. Also the internet connection is slower then and old dial up server. Do yourself a favor and look somewhere else
They take great pride in taking care of this place from the grounds to the rooms everything is kept up with great care we love the place and will always go back.
This spot is a step above a Super 8, very nice rooms and great service.The pool was super and had a little meet and greet that was nice, close to beaches.

You will not find a better hotel in this price range! The room decor is a bit aged but  it is clean,the property is well maintained and the entire staff goes out of their way to make sure you have a good stay! If we are back in the area we will be one of their many repeat customers!! Bonuses the pool area is very nice and we'll maintained and from 5-8 every evening they serve complimentary wine,soft drinks and snacks!!

Every time we go to a concert at the Observatory we stay at the Super 8. I highly recommend upgrading to the suite as they are very spacious and comfortable. The place could be a little cleaner but you get what you pay for. It's right in the middle of everything bars, restaurants, clubs you name it! I recommend the super 8 if you are in the area

The staff was very friendly and accommodating and allowed me check in early because I had been flying all day. Super easy to get to and they had a large parking lot. Definitely would stay here again. The pool and hot tub were clean as well! A major rarity!

Summary Heading: Spacious, clean rooms with double sinks. Great location.
Summary: Very spacious, clean and quiet rooms with double sinks!  Lots of counter space.  Ours even had a jacuzzi tub.  Well maintained pool and hot tub. At reasonable rates. Located in a nice area of Costa Mesa. Down the street from Newport Beach.  Close to shopping and restaurants.

Summary Heading: Edgar, William, and Irvin were wonderful and attentive.
Summary: I seriously felt like I was in a 5 star.  My husband and I were so impressed by the staff and our room service.  A gem of a place to find for sure.  We are from Las Vegas. We stay downtown in LV all  the time.  We were so lucky and refreshed to find this place and enjoy every day at Newport Beach, Laguna and Dana Point. Outstanding. thank you. We'll be back in October for sure.  Jack and Ashley H.

This was one of the best Super 8 motels I have stayed at (which has been quite a few).  Service was outstanding.  Front desk very responsive to requests.  At breakfast we couldn't ask for more.  There were waffles, hot and cold cereal, yogurt, fruit, coffee, juices, sweet rolls, bread and bagels to toast.  Cold milk (2% and whole), butter, peanut butter, jelly, syrup.  All well stocked and fresh.  Area very clean.  Room was quiet, clean, and had all toiletries we needed.  Fairly large refrigerator in room.  Microwave was handy.  Everything worked well.  Beds were very comfortable.  Motel was close to many attractions and easy to get to.  So glad we stayed here.  Free wifi was easy to access and I had no problems with speed or ability to connect. Price was very reasonable,

Summary Heading: The staff was very nice and went the extra mile. The room...
Summary: The staff was very nice and went the extra mile. The room was clean except for the carpet. It was vacuumed, but had stains and left your feet black if you walked without shoes. The pool area was very nice, but you didn't get enough towels to swim and bathe.

Summary Heading: Still worth it even with the couple of glitches
Summary: We had gone to this hotel the year before. This time we were in a different room. It was all pretty good except the bed was uncomfortable. They need to get new mattresses and they should have the A/C turned on. It was very hot and humid when we got in the room and we were given a room key even though the maid was not done in room. They still had the wine and cheese thing on Saturday after 5pm. The breakfast was good in the morning too.

Summary Heading: Always clean and the rooms are large
Summary: We have stayed at this hotel over 5 times this year. The rooms are large and roomy and the front desk staff is always friendly. I especially like the fact that they have a sauna and a very nice swimming pool. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Summary Heading: I have stayed at this location a couple times and it is...
Summary: I have stayed at this location a couple times and it is always clean and quiet. Obviously this is not a luxury hotel but it is a good place to stay for a reasonable price. Rooms are spacious, the most recent time I stayed it looked like they put a fresh coat of paint and new carpet and remodeled shower. Wish they had more than 2 pillows on the bed and the wi-fi never works for me :( other than that I enjoy staying here

Summary Heading: Even though the décor is a little outdated, the rooms were...
Summary: Even though the décor is a little outdated, the rooms were very clean including the bathroom. The queen bed was very comfortable.  Plenty of electrical outlets for ironing etc. and the breakfast had several options including waffles, bagels, toast, cereal etc.  A great hotel for the price.  Located very close to Orange County Airport/

I stayed here twice as it was close to the coast and beach cities that I enjoyed going to.  My latest stay was July 10th of 2015.  The check in process was easy although the young man was outside taking a break.  Had to call the hotel so he would come back in to check me in.  It was not an issue.  I enjoyed the wine at check in.    Our room was clean and in working order.  We did have a hard time adjusting the clock which was way off.  Haha!  We did see a few shady persons on property but they didn't seem to cause any problems. It was quiet after 9 PM.  We slept okay as the bed was comfortable.  Breakfast was so-so better than most Super 8s.  We had waffles and beagles with juice and coffee.  Very basic but suffice.    The check out process was very easy thanks to that handsome

The staff is very friendly and accommodating! They provide shuttle service to the fair, which is the main reason for my stay at this location. The rooms are nice, shower in excellent condition! Wish we could have stayed another day!
We felt very comfortable and pampered at our stay. The room was a good size and well designed. Check in was easy and the staff was very friendly.

We booked this hotel far in advance and good thing we did because they were sold out when we checked in. The front desk was nice and helpful.  Having complimentary wine in the afternoon and Continental breakfast in the morning was great! Room was clean and ac worked great thank goodness. They did not have any shampoo lucky we brought ours and the towels were a bit stained.
Best Super 8 we have ever stayed. Great facilities and service. Location perfect in safe residential area close to restaurants and shopping and only about 8 miles from Huntington Beach.

This Super 8 had lots of extras - swimming pool, dry sauna, jacuzzi hot tub, wine and crackers from 5pm to 8pm, breakfast with waffles, and a nice quiet location.Great wifi and easy drive access to Newport Beach and to Santa Ana (John Wayne) airport. Helpful front desk star told us of 3 very good cafes in walking distance.

My daughter, husband, granddaughter, & her 2 children checked into one room & I checked into another room.  My daughter found a bedbug in her room & had to be moved at 11:45 PM..Since she was placed in a room with only one bad, my granddaughter & her 2 children had to come to my room at 12:30 A.M. to sleep, & they were so upset we were up most of the night.  As if that wasn't enough, even though I had checked in for 2 nights, when I came back to the motel the next day after visiting my son,, my room had been given  away & someone's clothes were in my room.  I had to get all my things together & move to an other room.  My privacy had been invaded & my valuables were at risk.  I should sue you but I won't.. I just will never again stay at a Super 8 again.  The least you could have

Summary Heading: This super 8 is a cut above the rest
Summary: Arrived there early and Were allowed to check in early without extra charge.  Room was nice and clean included an ice box comfortable seating and a nice pool hot tub area.  Front desk rep Edgar is exceptionally nice and helpful.  Afternoon snack of crackers and (boxed) wine.  Breakfast bar was nicely stacked and kept up.  Only two negatives keeping it from being 5 star  First the sauna was closed second if u require a door card to get ice u should also require one to access the pool area for safety reasons.   We were out there late 9 pm and there were some shady fully dressed character s and I did not feel entirely safe.   Also saw some pool patrons leave in cars so no for a fact they were not staying there.

Was upset that when I got there at 4:30 my room was not ready when check-in is at 2pm. This was the 2nd time this happened last time the room was a mess and they gave me another room. This time all rooms were taken and we had to wait about 30 minutes very inconvenient after a long day of a soccer tournament.
We have great time, the Manager Edgar wash very professional, good location , clean and friendly stuff. We be back thank you for everything .

Summary Heading: 4-week stay at the Super 8 in Costa Mesa
Summary: A nice facility, with a good location, reasonal room rate, close to shopping and to Newport Beach, one of the best beaches around. The management staff, Edgar in particular are very efficient, accomodating and wouldn't spare an effort to fullfil a reasonable request. The mini suite was good as it has 2 TV's and microwave, refrigerator and a sink. They offer a nice continental breakfast with waffles etc..Nice clean pool and seating area. We stayed 4 weeks and felt good about the facility every day. We plan on going back in August.

This motel Is a great place to stay. From the management to the housekeeping to the groundsmen and maintenance everyone goes out of their way to make everything perfect for your stay. Grounds are kept up perfectly. Pool is wonderful. Spa is terrific. Breakfast in the morning is great. The management and staff are friendly courteous respectful and kind and care very much about the needs of their guests.  I would recommend this motel to anyone.

Great value.  Close to the beach, shopping, and restaurants.  The staff is very courteous.  We had one problem, a loose toilet seat.  They repaired the next day.  The rooms are a little dated but they are large and clean.

This is a great place to stay. Older, but very clean, courteous staff, really has everything you need. Love the recliners in the king bed rooms. I have been staying here every once in awhile over the last ten years or so when I am in the area.

Checked in to what was supposed to be accessible room, 2 queen beds for 2 adults and 1 child. Hand held shower didn't work at all, refrigerator door was off, toilet seat was very loose. Room had 1 queen & 1 double bed & was not "accessible." Day manager was able to move us to an accessible room for the last two nights and even moved our luggage for us, but both days the housekeeping staff left only 2 washcloths, one hand towel, and 3 bath towels for 3 people!

Stayed in king bed room. Room was OK. Had a odd smell. No shampoo or conditioner. Carpets were very dirty.my daughter was walking around the room and it turned the bottom of her feet black.if they cleaned carpets the room would smell better. Had nice TV with plenty of channels for my daughter watch when in the room. Room was decent size with table desk mini fridge and recliner and ottoman. Convenient to beach and restaurants

To strt off my room was not ready had to wait another hour to check in!!!Smell was musky,old bed you feel the springs,terrible old blanket ,beat up pillows.Lot's of shady people around,especially at night.My wife did not feel comfortable there.People honking horns all night ,will not stay there again.Brutal breakfast as well

Summary Heading: Work and Pleasure been staying at this property for 10 years.
Summary: During my many stays at this Super 8 they are always improving the landscape and rooms. Great access to Newport Beach however parking can be a problem from time to time. It seems everything is just 10 min.s away or closer. Friendly front desk. Clean pool, Edgar has been a great person and Mgr. Competitive rates and easy beach access. Try it, you will like it.

Part of the Wyndham Group, I have used this venue for several overnight business trips.  The location is close to the 405 fwy on Harbor Blvd.  Food and services are walking distance.  The parking is good.  The rooms are larger in size and always clean.  The wireless is so so.  It is actually a better location than the Ramada in that is down the street and a much better price!.
The room was clean and the staff friendly. The breakfast was also very good.
I have been staying at this Super 8 for years. Always seems to be clean. Price of the room has gone up, but it is a handy place to stay.

We stayed at this hotel on our California trip. We initially had to wait for our room even though we arrived at 4pm and check in was 3pm. We got in at about 4:30 once it had been cleaned. The check in guy was lovely and friendly. He informed us of happy hour which was free wine, soft drinks, nachos and trail mix for a couple of hours.  We particularly enjoyed this. We had a suite at this hotel and the room was lovely.  It had a separate area with a comfy chair and foot rest, an extra TV,  a fridge, coffee machine and microwave. It was lovely and clean.  The TV in the main bedroom was huge. There was adequate parking. Breakfast was simple, coffee, wafiles, pastries, cereals  etc.  It was adequate. The location was good also. Close to Newport Pier and beach only a 5- 10 min drive.

Summary Heading: The most relaxed, kick back, and nice looking motel I've ever been at before.
Summary: This motel is a great price and the rooms are good size, very clean, and decorated quite decent. The environment at and around the motel is very laid back and relaxing. The pool area is nice and there's a gazebo to smoke at if you'd choose to. Nobody bothers you and it's quiet. I'd recommend this place to anyone who's looking for a place to stay while visiting southern california/orange county or who's just looking for a place to stay. Great for just you or the whole family. I am going to stay there today actually lol!!!

Although it was a non-smoking room, the room still smelled like stale smoke. We only needed it to crash for the night so i didn't ask the front desk to move us. Other than that the motel met expectations.

We stayed in the suite. It's a big room but the decor is OUTDATED. It's clean , it does have a dingy smell but overall I was comfortable. Lots of restaurant up the street. Very convenient to the main stores.
The room was clean and the location is good. The check in and out was easy and the office staff were friendly. I would definitely stay here again.

Summary Heading: Great choice for a few nights
Summary: This motel is not fancy, but its very comfortable. The staff is friendly and helpful, the rooms are very spacious and well equipped for a Super 8, TVs were new and there was a fridge & microwave in the room. There's a decent dive bar next door (almost attached, really) called Patrick's Pub. Walking distance to several restaurants, convenience stores, and grocery stores. I did have some (unreported) problems with fellow hotel guests; namely drunk people filtering out of the pub around 2am to come home and screaming/making noise down in the parking lot. Otherwise, great experience. I will definitely stay here again should I find myself in the area.

Very convenient area. Lots of restaurants in area to choose from. Was not happy with breakfast. All there was to  choose from was waffles, toast, cinnamon rolls and cereal. Not a good breakfast for children-didn't even have chocolate milk.

Our original stay was 6 nights, but we liked it so much we added another 3.  Edgar was fantastic!  Super 8 has a great continental breakfast with a variety of choices.  I watched Edgar, who I assume is the Mgr.... as I was eating breakfast...he was checking in a severely handicapped man.....he was so professional and patient...I was very impressed.   From there he began to straighten up the eating area, and dealt with other quests.  I highly recommend staying here.  The rooms are clean and the staff is very accommodating.
Excellent. Staff was professional and friendly. Front desk addressed and resolved a noise issue next door in the middle of the night. I was quite impressed.

Summary Heading: For a Super8, this is good
Summary: First impression was of a very good Super8, with an impressive foyer (by Super8 standards), soft drink and snacks provided mid-afternoon, and reasonable service at the counter. The pool was decent sized and clean. The rooms were reasonable, with the only issue being the dark colours of everything and the wrinkled carpet near the bathroom. We were upstairs near the top of the staircase, which wasn't ideal as there was no elevator and we had quite a bit of luggage to repack on the last day of our holiday, plus a fair bit of foot traffic in the early hours of the morning. Parking was not possible near the room due to the double story layout, but this is fairly typical of the chain. The location is very good, with many shops within walking distance and although they are located on a

Had never stayed at a Super 8, and expected it to be cheap-o. But it was very nice: clean, spacious, good towels, included breakfast, excellent front desk interaction. Definitely recommend, and will consider a good future option.

Summary Heading: My many visits to this Hotel.
Summary: Excellant location to Newport Beach. Easy access, Friendly staff, Bar on site with pool table and nice atmosphere. Clean rooms, large flat screen T.V. and internet Wifi connection but slow. Just down the street Golden Dragon four star Chinese food at a 3 star price. Nice clean pool and Hot tub, Rooms are larger then most, with extras like Frig. and large vanity. You will like this place.
Very good motel.  Clean.  Easily accessible.  Very pleasant staff.  Price was right.  Only drawback was no elevator to second floor.  Would stay there again.

Summary Heading: Great Place, Great Price, Central Located
Summary: Very Nice Clean Place, Great Staff, Nice Pool and Hot Tub-used both, Nice Continental Breakfast, Nice location for all around activities around California between San Diego and Los Angeles. great Deal for the money......

Summary Heading: Great Date with Super 8 Costa Mesa
Summary: ALthough an older property the Manager and staff are very friendly and courteous as well as helpful. Being a disabled Veteran the accommodations and vehicle safety is important to  us.   Great Job Edgar  Thanks   Ric & BILLG

I have seen good and bad reviews for this location, and honestly I had a nice stay. My room was clean, plenty of towels, I did have to request an extra pillow as they were pretty flat but that was my only issue.  Yes the rooms are a older, but not in bad shape just dated.The location was perfect for what I needed. I stayed 5 nights and the only other complaint i would have is that they didn't refill my coffee once.

Summary Heading: Definitely one of the better hotels in oc.
Summary: nice large flat screen TVs with free on demand.the property is well maintained.a bar on the premises. Close to shopping.and the staff is great.I've stayed here twice in the past year.internet needs improvement.overall...definitely recommend..

I really like the location and accommodation for the price.  This is my second stay that has left me without Internet connection.  This time I could not enter key number.  Wireless devices could  not locate signal.  Front desk put me in an optimal location.   They were not able to figure a resolution.

Summary Heading: Great prices and well kept older property
Summary: Stayed here 5 nights on vacation visiting Newport Beach, which is five minutes away.   Great big new Flatscreen with 100 channels including several by HBO.  It is in kind of a blue collar area, but I felt safe. Friendly staff with breakfast and free drinks each evening.  Adjacent is Patrick's Pub which has an eclectic mix of blue collar types and college age kids, good barkeeps, pool tables, darts, and a jukebox sound system.  They do have smoking rooms available.  Large fridge in the room but no microwave. The pool and hot tub are clean, and the place is beautifully landscaped.  I wish all older properties were this nice.  Great budget place.

This property is on a main thoroughfare, but very quiet and serene. Curb-side appearance is deceiving, because we were very pleasantly surprised by our room. It looked to be recently updated with very comfortable beds. The bath was separate from the vanity/sink area, which eased morning dressing preparations. The location is several miles from the I-405, but presented no difficulty in getting around the area. We would definitely stay there again.

I was repeatedly asked to please pay for a room for me by a homeless woman from the moment I got there, and this continued several more times when she saw me outside. I offered her $20 to help, but she insisted on $40-60, I finally just left the property to avoid her. Then, later that night I was awaken several times by the Crackheads next door partying loud and coming and going all night. I got about 3 hours sleep during my stay. I worked 10 hours the next day, and was not happy at all about my lack of sleep. NEVER AGAIN!

We arrived later in the evening after a flight that was turbulent and unsettling. William was at the desk when we arrived, and immeaditely we felt as if we had arrived at home. The motel was clean and inviting, the room fairly spacious and clean, the grounds well lit and clean. Our stay there was      "super great". The contential breakfast was good, with many choices. We will return gladly and recommend this motel to any of our circle of friends that asks.William and his behavior and actions are enough for us to return here again. He was undoubtly "above and beyond" to ensure our stay was as nice as possible.We thank you personally, William. Dave & Maggie

For a motel located in the beautiful Costa Mesa/Newport area of California, this location can't rely on its location forever. Murphy beds? Sagging mattresses, old shabby bedding, and carpeting in desperate need of cleaning? The only plus is the staff. During our stay, we spent 1 night at the Super 8 in Monterey. It was immaculate with beautiful furnishings, comfortable mattresses, and plush towels, for the same price.

The rooms were clean  and tidy , the  area is maybe not for family with small kids,  but me and wifey will be back ,well worth the price and best off all was the staff ,friendly and helpful very easy,i felt very welcome and sort off home.       All the best .richard and cristel from sweden.

Summary Heading: Love this property!! The rooms are clean, staff friendly ...
Summary: Love this property!! The rooms are clean, staff friendly & helpful nice breakfast, even offer  wine & snacks in afternoons!! It's in a great location near many attractions, dinning, nightlife and shopping.  I highly recommend this property if your in the Costa Mesa/Orange County area.

Summary Heading: Hotel was nice and clean  there was a lady going around...
Summary: Hotel was nice and clean  there was a lady going around  bugging people she even popped  her head in my room but staff was right behind her asking her to leave the property  the room carpet could have been cleaner

When we arrived on Thursday (1/22), check-in went smoothly and there were no problems with our voucher or reservation.  When we opened the door of our room, we did not like the smell of the room.  They must have used some cleaning product or something, but it was not a pleasant smell.  There was no tub in the bathroom, only a raised wall (you *could take a bath, but it would not be comfortable).  The water pressure on the shower head was almost non-existent. Also, there was nothing in the bathroom to explain how to get water to the hand-held shower head, and we could not figure it out ourselves. The bed was a king size, but it was not comfortable to me.  Husband didn't seem to have any complaints.  There were only 3 flat pillows and we had to ask for more pillows.  Connecting to
Check in was a breeze. The desk clerk was polite, helpful and a kind person. Would stay here again.  Only complaint was there seemed to be a little to much activity in the parking lot late at night.

Summary Heading: Our Hair Dryer Caught On Fire and No Body Cared...
Summary: Nice people at the desk...the ice bucket was nowhere to be found and no one at the office had one...they gave me a small plastic bag for my ice...the hair dryer caught on fire, smoked up the room and when I told the desk manager it seemed like it wasn't important. We stayed the second night and no one came by to check on the hair dryer...the coffee was good...but the wifi was very slow...I don't believe we will be returning... Sorry...

This is a dated Super 8 by design . BUT I chose to stay there as I saw the PARKING was SAFE and secluded  from the street.  Everything was fine by my Standard. Rooms are clean and comfortable. Facility is quite.

This was a great Super 8. We had trouble with the DVD player and the manager of the night came to our room and set it up for us.  They also have a happy hour with wine and snacks.  Great little extra!  Will stay there again when we go back to the coast.

Stayed here for second time for a week plus. First time was end of march. It was perfect for my needs. Family lives 10 minutes away, pool was warm, hot tub HOT, pool area clean. They could use some new lounge pads n maybe cut back the foliage for more sun. Otherwise its quite pleasant. All kinds of little shops, banks, rental cars, n resturants within walkin Distance. Staff friendly, rooms clean, and grounds are well taken care of. I'd like to see a bit of upgrade n pillows n linens but for what I needed it was perfect both times. Travelling solo but with family in Huntington Beach made it a perfect place to recharge. FYI get room on office side or back side to avoid pub

Police presence (4 officers at a time ). Roaches. Bed like a blowup mattress on plywood. Pubic hairs on sheet.  Sheets appeared to be used (wrinkled ). Shower wand broken. Trinkle of hot water. This place sucks!
Rooms were clean and the shower worked properly.  Breakfast was good and location for my destination was very nice.
A very nice hotel clean, friendly & very helpful staff. It had a nice breakfast & popcorn, cookies, with some drinks for evening. Will stay there again when in area.
Room, Grounds and lobby were very clean.  Spa and pool were well maintained.  Bed was on the hard side.  Breakfast was adequate, waffle maker, some cereal, packaged danish, fruit.

Neighbor next to us were very noisy into the night ( 2 am) disrupting our sleep. Also the neighbor's smoking outside their and our door, still came into our suite. The room I stayed in needed a new mattress. Too soft and no support.
not a bad place for the price. The guy at the front counter was very professional and helpful. I would stay at the hotel again as the service was good, the property was also goof for a motel.

Summary Heading: Super 8 Costa Mesa / Newport Beach Area
Summary: We enjoyed a fabulous stay at this motel. The rooms were amongst the best we had experienced throughout our journey which started from Chicago. The facilities in the room were very functional and included all we wanted.  The cleaning staff were both friendly and diligent. The breakfast room was very well appointed and comfortable. Early evening complementary wine and snacks were well received and represented first class value. There was also an excellent pool and bar on the grounds. The front of house staff were a credit to the  Super 8 organisation, being both courteous, extremely helpful and and accommodating. I would highly recommend a stay at this motel a credit to the Super 8 chain. Particular mention must go to the manager Edgar Cobian who without any doubt the best front

Excellent front desk service from all 3 shifts. Youthful, well trained in the hospitality industry. Never had to call for anything, actually walked on carpet barefooted. Wine & snacks in pm and excellent breakfast. Close to every place I wanted to visit. It's my new home in So-Cal!

Pros: Great location, good price   Cons: Check in was at 2, but I couldn't get into the room until 3:20 pm because the room had not been cleaned. The room was also not properly cleaned, because it was rushed.

we stayed here 1 night for the sand sports supershow. The staff was great, pool area clean, grounds well kept up. As far as the rooms go they are in need of an update they are showing age as well as wear and tear. We were going to take the shuttle to the show but it was picking up other guests at the airport, a employee took us to the show in his personal car and picked us up as well. He was a college student going to school days and working nights, I threw him a tip and thanked him service like this will ensure a return visit for next years show.

Summary Heading: Mgr was Excellent, Some Things Better Than Expected
Summary: Pros: + Manager was GREAT.  + Pool was clean. + Breakfast good; free box wine/soda/snacks. + Easy group reservations.  Cons: + Bad smell in room (over air freshener to compensate for bathroom stench). + Odd characters in parking lot (tell Manager and he'll help). + Odd shower head (ask Manager how to use).

Check in was easy, the staff was helpful and friendly, the room was clean and the breakfast area was well stocked. My only complaint would be the pillows were flatter than pancakes and need replacement.

We stayed here two nights because we needed a reasonably priced hotel in area since I was having a minor outpatient surgery in Newport Beach. We first walked in and were struck with an overwhelming musty smell like the room had been closed up for months with a wet dog living there. We left the door and window open wide for over an hour in attempt to air the place out to no avail. The carpets were also very dirty. Our bare feet developed a dark tinge by the end of the day from walking on it. This place needs a huge overhaul and new carpets. Would NOT stay here again.

Edgar Cobian manager was the first pleasant surprise , very nice and made us feel very welcome - second surprise was the cleanliness of the rooms and property. Kind of pricey but have complimentary breakfast and snacks an wine at 5 til 9.. Only thing the walk from parking lot to upstairs rooms is quite long and a lot of stairs ! Will defi lately be staying again when the area !
This Motel is just perfect for our types of travel to Orange County. Its clean,offers breakfast and snacks in the evening. We love it and plan on continuing to stay there.
The Front Desk and staff are courteous and helpful, good breakfast offered, clean property near major attractions and close to highways.

Summary Heading: nice room compared to last visit
Summary: I was on first floor  room 120  it appears they did some renovation since my last visit.  My only obection was the price.
filthy sticky carpet. 2 empty condom wrappers on floor. big hair ball on floor. hadn't been vacuumed

Loved the Costa Mesa Super 8.  Great pool, nice breakfast, convenient location, small and fairly quiet except at bar time when Patrick's lets out in the parking lot.  Staff is extremely accommodating and professional.  Only gripe is that I made my reservation 4 months in advance for 5 nights and somehow they cancelled my reservation when they couldn't reach me at 4 pm on the day of my check in.  I was traveling with my three kids and had no messages; phone, text, or email warning me.  Orange County Fair was in town and they wanted to rebook my room.  I arrived at 8 pm after a long day and the four of us were told we did not have a room.  Major hassle that caused way too much stress, issues with my car rental, extra cab fare, and not to mention scrambling for a place to sleep.

Room was in good location.  Plenty of parking and nice landscaping.  Room had old smell.  Furnishings were old and worn.  TV was new and best part of room.  Bed and pillows were old and uncomfortable.  Room was spacious and had good refrigerator.  If some money was invested to update the rooms furnishings, this would rate a lot higher. Noisy Air conditioning unit.

Stayed at this Super 8 location for this year's Pageant Of The Masters & our overall impression was *just* on this side of OK.  I'd probably read this was 2.5 stars but rounded up due to the nice staff  Our flight was earlier than originally thought & we ended up arriving to the motel around 1 pm but they were nice enough to let us check in early - our room wasn't quite ready but we only had to wait about 20 min for the cleaning staff to finish up.....& I overheard the front desk telling a caller that they were fully booked for the night so seems like this place is a popular choice  The 1st thing we noticed upon room entry was the super-strong odor of "heavily-traversed / public restroom" & bathroom cleaner - not the best of scents.  Also sorry to note the carpets weren't very

I spent 8 days at this property, had a single queen bed room and got more than I expected. The check in staff were extremely professional and friendly. The room I had was good, with a queen size bed, big flat screen television with a great range of cable channels (including live baseball which I love to watch), and the real bonus for me of a spa bath in my room, as well as a fridge and microwave. Breakfast was good, and the pool was great, heated and with a hot spa right next to it. Also there is a pub right at the end of the driveway, which was handy. The cleaning staff were also good, did their jobs well. Also plenty of off street parking, with major shops and amenities close by. Next time I'm in Los Angeles, I will stay there again.

I stayed at the Super 8 because I have family that got a discount through a rewards program.  My review is based on paying 40% less than advertised prices.  If I had not had this discount, I would have rated this hotel lower because in my opinion it was not a very exciting place to stay.  I was in town for medical appointments, and it was a convenient location for me that I could afford. After traveling over 8 hours in horrible traffic (a trip that normally takes me about 4hours), I was ready for a hot soak in a nice tub.  I was extremely exhausted and very disappointed that there was NO TUB in the hotel room.  I was told I could not get a room with a tub until the next afternoon, but due to my schedule and exhaustion I decided to forego the move.  I slept good three of the four

Hotel in good repair. Has swimming pool, spa and sauna all in good order. Front desk, maintenance and housekeeping personnel wonderful to guest. Room was clean and in good repair. Free breakfast and happy hour.

I have stayed at this property before and am very satisfied with this property for our needs.   I book 7 to 10 rooms for my group as we perform at the OC Fair and need a inexpensive, comfortable hotel close to the fairgrounds and Super 8 satisfies all our needs.

We had a nice time we went inthe pool it was warm next morning we had to wait till ten I think that should be changed to 9 am so we can swim longer but he let us stay later that was nice overall we will be back next year we are going whale watching

We are always amazed at the consistent cleanliness and comfort, terrific service, high quality no matter which Super 8 and no matter where-east coast or west ! These folks have their act6 together and will remain my first choice for quality lodging at reasonable cost!

Front staff not friendly, no coffee in am two days in a row, someone had to tell front desk.( lobby) Toilet making noise all night long, room not stocked with enough towels or cups for coffee or water, dirty carpets, and bad location, can't just turn in if your going north on hour or blvd, you have to make u turn, don't bother, pay a little more, and get something decent!

Smelly/ unclean / first two nights awful and eventually we were moved because there were cockroaches. We were supposed to be in a three room but they made a mistake so three of us had to share a bed. There weren't any spare camp beds or pillows. Worst place I have ever stayed.

My family and I stayed at this motel for 9 nights recently for a family visit.  Our room was very clean and spacious, and it had a large flat-screen television which was unexpected.  The refrigerator worked well to keep drinks chilled.  The beds were very comfortable.  The maid staff was very efficient and was extremely good at what they do--our rooms were always tidy, clean and re-stocked with plenty of fresh towels when we returned every night.  Not having an elevator makes it somewhat difficult to get our large luggage to the second floor where our room was--if you have large luggage, ask for a room at ground level.  Overall, I commend manager Edgar for providing superb customer service--our time spent here was excellent and we will definitely return.

We stayed for 3 nights on a recent family trip. The staff is very friendly and helpful, however I feel there is some shady activities going on around the motel, there is residence of this motel.  The rooms are ok, they have a smell and the carpets are so dirty our feet were black after a shower. I would recommend this for a night or two but I think if they want more people they need to invest in a deep clean!! We went to WalMart and purchased our own pillows and kep the blankets away from face.  Breakfast selections was good, however we chose not to eat there after all.

Summary Heading: This is better than every hotel I have stayed at
Summary: When we got to the hotel there was a hiccup. I thought all hotels had elevators by now. This one didn't so they had to change my room due my handicap but in changing the room they upgraded us. It was a wonderful room. Had a little kitchen and an light up area to do makeup.  . The pool was clean and the had a place next to pool where you could just sit and relax.  Also on Saturday nights they have wine tastings at 5pm which is not something I expected at a Super 8. To get ice you had to put your  room key in which I think is great since there are alot of people that would just go to the machine and fill up all there big coolers.  We went there because the OC Fair wasn't far from the hotel. Most people could walk to it but we had heard about the shuttle.  During the weekends the

My husband and I stayed here with our boys while visiting the area beaches for two days.  Location was great for Newport beach, Laguna Beach and Huntington Beach.  Our room was spotless except for the carpet.  The carpet desperately needed cleaned or replaced.  Room had a fridge.  Bed was very comfy.  My kids loved the heated pool and jacuzzi tub next to the pool.  There was one incident of loud inappropriate music being played at the pool but the manager came out and put a stop to it.  Otherwise the motel was very quiet.  Good selection at the free breakfast.  They did offer free snacks in the evening which was a nice touch.  Compared to the Super 8's we stayed at in Monterey and San Fran, I liked this one the most.

Summary Heading: This Super 8 Budget Motel is a Good One
Summary: I was very reluctant to book another Super 8 because our last Super 8 in Escondido, CA stay was a bad experience.  I had already made a reservation at Fairfield Inn by Marriott.  Based on Tripadvisor's rating, their room cost/night was better than some other budget hotels but with a higher rating.  Because of the price difference from Fairfield Inn in Costa Mesa, reluctantly we "go for broke" in trusting Tripadvisor's review rating and reserved and paid for in advance at this Super 8 for 2 nights.  We were pleasantly surprised. The front desk clerk was quite pleasant and my request for a room with not much walking was honored.  We were assigned to a non-smoking first floor room.  Room was cleaned and smoke free.  The carpet is a little worn.  The room has a refrigerator, coffee

Stayed w/family in mult. rooms for a mini vaca. Rooms were clean, staff excellent. My son wanted to stay permanently! Breakfast was great. I was surprised @ the offer of a happy hour. Will stay again.

Pros: Front desk staff was friendly and helpful.  Free breakfast, wine, and snacks.  Heated pool and Jacuzzi.  Cons: The floors were absolutely filthy in room 206. The carpet, wallpaper, and bathroom tile are at least from the late 80s or early 90s. The cleaning staff is terrible.  There is no iron or ironing board in the room.  I asked to use an iron for 3 consecutive days.  I finally had to go to Target and buy my own.

We had an overall good stay.  William was very helpful and considerate. He even helped us to get some breakfast as we had to leave for the airport at 4:30 in the morning.The room was clean. Our air conditioner was a little noisy. Our breakfast was sufficient. We would stay again. Thanks.

Summary Heading: The hotel was "ok" stayed with my husband and two children...
Summary: The hotel was "ok" stayed with my husband and two children.  Knew it would be cheaper end...that's why we picked it.  All I can say is you get what you pay for.  The other guests were loud.  There was a very "loud" argument in the parking lot. The air conditioner in our room was putting out a funk odor that was unbearable.  They did change the air unit out the next day.  The free breakfast was very limited compared to other hotels. Overall, it was what was expected for the price.  You get what you pay for!

Super 8 Costa Mesa is inexpensive and the location is great. Breakfast area was often dirty and coffee ran out constantly. Pool was nice. First nonsmoking room smelled like smoke. Room changed, no problem, but second room toilet ran continuously. Took 2 days to fix. Overall, not the best bargain hotel I have utilized.
I was pleasantly surprised. The hotel was reasonably clean (the carpet could have used a shampoo) and the staff was great. I will definitely stay here again when I'm in Orange County.

Excellent, friendly service from staff. Staff helped me find local restaurants and my bank branch. Enjoyable breakfast. Quiet. We got a free upgrade to a mini-suite. Free DVDs on loan. Good central location for the places I wanted to visit. Two complaints. First, we chose this motel because it advertised "recliners." I expected a Lazy Boy type. What I got was more like a padded, metal-armed desk chair which happened to recline. It wasn't nearly as comfortable as what I was expecting. Second, although I got a non-smoking room, as requested, and although several of the rooms next to my second floor room were also non-smoking, guests were allowed to sit outside their rooms, ashtray in hand, and smoke to their heart's content. This meant I usually had to traverse a narrow walkway,

Great property for the price. Staff goes over and above to assist. Pool is a chlorine - salt water mix and so fresh. Hotel did  great job balancing the "Disney bunch" and the "hotel types" ... We felt very safe, welcomed and would stay again. Manager Edgar is top notch!!

I read all the reviews for this location and I wasn't disappointed nice place staff were great too! the only downfall was there could be a little better selection for breakfast but it's better than nothing we would definitely stay here again close to many places to visit
room was clean and neat.  appliances worked.  Pool was heated and in good repair as was the hot tub and the sauna.  Staff were friendly and helpful.  Location was perfect.

Was far better than we had expected. Room was clean, spacious and fully met our requirements. Breakfast was adequate. Pool area looked clean, had ample shade areas and enough lounge patio furniture. By far the best part of our stay was the staff. Everyone was very friendly and a very special mention has to be made of William, the front desk person. He was exceptional. Warm greeting, easy check in, very accomodating and always ready to give helpful advise on eating places, places to visit, etc.

The room I was assigned had a barely lit, flickering bathroom light, which could not be repaired by the on-site staff.  It also had a non-functioning spaghetti bulb in a fixture.  I had therefore to be moved after mostly already having inpacked.  The staff was helpful and apologetic.   The chest of drawers in the second room was old an rough, and needs to be refinished or replaced.  I also had trouble getting the TV to work, and it turns out that a tiny receiver block at the end of a wire had been pushed to the back of the TV.  Problem was idenitified and rectified with a visit from the staff.  The flourescent fixture over the sink in the bathroom area in the new room had a slight flcker, too, but was repaired at my request.   I have stayed a couple of times a year for a number

We stayed at the Super 8 to participate in the OC Marathon.  Upon arrival the desk clerk was quite friendly as he checked us in.  He told us they had snacks in the lobby in the evening, wine, soda and chips.  Breakfast started at 6am but we were leaving at 5:30 for the marathon.  I asked the clerk if we could have some cinnamon rolls to take with us and he gladly gave them to us.  The next morning when we checked out, the clerk on duty had set breakfast out early, which was nice.  This was a nice quiet hotel and the price was wonderful for the area.  The only problem we had was figuring out how to switch the water from the shower wand to the shower head.  Other than that, we had a wonderful stay and will definitely stay in this hotel again when we're in the area.

The staff was friendly and helpful.  The room (one bed) was really big, it had a large (I would guess 42in) flat screen tv in the bedroom and a tiny office desk with plenty of light.  It also had a separate kitchenette with fold down table, mini fridge, microwave, nice chair, and a smaller (possibly 32in) flat screen tv.  The hotel had a pool, but I was only there for a 1/2 marathon and had to leave, thus did not get to experience it.  I liked the size of the room and the free (included i should say) breakfast and evening snack the best.

Summary Heading: The room was very clean, just needed to replace the carpet...
Summary: The room was very clean, just needed to replace the carpet and upgrade the mattress. Otherwise my stay was great.

My stay experience in this hotel has been exceptional. Specifically, the service in this hotel is of a very high quality. Edgar, the manager listens to your requirements and makes one's stay very pleasant. He is very cooperative, considerate and helps his guests in every way possible. We are thankful to Edgar and all the team for the wonderful work they are doing. We recommend this hotel very strongly.  From: Ahmed Family
We had to be careful not to slip in the jacuzzi tub. Tenants upstairs noisy when their water is on.

Rooms smells bad that it will really get into your clothes. Towels are old and worn out. Toilet paper were not being replaced. Leftover from previous occupant. I thought I can saved but with the whole experience and the uncomfortable that I went thru is not worth the saving.  For a $15.00 difference I rather go to a better hotel.

Summary Heading: We enjoyed our stay at this facility and would recommend it...
Summary: We enjoyed our stay at this facility and would recommend it to anyone. The price was very good and we had everything we needed for a comfortable stay. It was convenient to every place we needed to visit. (My only criticism was that the wallpaper in the room where the sink was located was very dirty, particularly in the section just to the left of the door leading into the bathroom. It needed a thorough scrub down. Our room was #217)

If you want an exceptional place to stay, you will find it at Super 8 Motel Costa Mesa/Newport Beach.  Edgar, the Manager, and his staff go out of their way to make your stay the best it can be.  Everyone is polite, professional and always willing to help.  My room was newly decorated (gorgeous) and clean.  The bed was great, the complimentary continental breakfast had a wide selection, and the motel is centrally located.  You can even walk to places to shop.  I love it here! Marsha L.

I stayed in the suite. Was pretty surprise of how roomy it was. Sofa in the living room was pretty comfy. Bed was good..AC worked. Needs a upgrade. Style was like early 90's. Everything was clean. Over all I was pleased. U het what u pay for. It was a good place to come to for a nite to get away feom my children.  Would come back.

Summary Heading: Two rooms for the price of one.
Summary: I was meeting a relative for a few days, and I was going to be paying for everything.  Normally, I like staying in nicer places, but in this case that would mean either sharing a room or paying a lot for two rooms.  I didn’t like either of those options.  So, I did a little research and found that I could get two rooms at this motel for the price of one room at a nicer place.  Perfect!  I was able to have my own room without paying a fortune.  Surprisingly, the rooms were actually pretty nice, and not that much different from some of the much more expensive rooms I often get.  The bed was comfortable.  The room was clean.  Internet was free.  There was even a pool, although we didn’t swim.  Overall, I was very pleased and I wouldn’t hesitate to stay here again.

The room was clean and TV worked well. Cheap night. Front desk guy was friendly and good at his job. The good ends there. Bad neighbourhood. Thin walls - could hear the snoring from the next room. Lots of walking and banging from floor above us.  Weird group of people hanging around the lobby area - I think they live there. Not very proximal to John Wayne airport if that is where you are flying out of. Shower was terrible - crappy shower head and water kept changing temperature from hot to cold. I was glad to be in and out within 12 hours. Do yourself a favour - pay a bit more for a better place.
cam here on business trip, great location from work and lots of restaurants and mall nearby. Friendly front desk folks.

We stayed for a whole week. The rooms were clean, the location was good because it was about 10-15 min from Huntington Beach, and there were plenty of stores and restaurants near by. The pool/hot tub was nice, and the grounds are very well kept. The breakfast was ok but very slim selection, and not very healthy. There seemed to be a few people who lived in the hotel, and they were of questionable character. I was a little worried and got the creeps having our 2 girls there. A lot of people who stayed were a little on the trashy side. We were on the first floor and could hear everything that went on upstairs. We come to this area a lot, but won't be staying here again. Good for a one night stay but not more than that.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your concerns regarding your recent stay at our property. We are glad that you also found the time to mention the positive aspects of the hotel. We do regret the impression that you came away with, particularly your description of the other guests who were staying at the same time. While there is not much we can do on how other guests comport themselves, you can rest assured that there are no security issues at our property. We may not be able to completely assuage your concerns, but we will always endeavour to do our best to take care of the needs of all our guests.

Summary Heading: Even tho it was a motel, it was a great stay for me. It was...
Summary: Even tho it was a motel, it was a great stay for me. It was easy and everything was relaxed. The staff was very accommodating and sorted out any queries I had.  Great stay for me, would definitely stay there again :-)

I don't stay at hotels often, but when I do it's usually unplanned. I can always count on Super 8 to provide a clean, comfortable room and friendly service. Staff was fine. I have yet to stay at a motel 6 to see how it compares against a super 8. I'v stayed at a Super 8 in Huntington Beach and Costa Mesa, positive experience.

This was our first visit here. We stayed three nights. The room was spacious, clean and the bed was comfortable. The grounds were well maintained, the pool area was nice and appeared to be very clean. The staff treated us wonderfully. Breakfast was the typical with waffles etc...(they also had a happy hour with soda and wine and snacks in the evening, which we didn't attend) what more could you expect especially at such an affordable price. It was conveniently located not far from the highway, restaurants and shopping. We will return here on our next trip.

We stayed here as a last minute family getaway.  They were very welcoming; providing a light snack in the evening as well as a wonderful breakfast in the morning.  They even beat the online price at the counter. My kids were very excited to get in the pool.  I was a little hesitant since it was a chilly evening, but the pool was so warm it was literally steaming in the evening air!  I even got in!!  The pool was good size and very clean.  The hot tub and Sauna were wonderful too.  Breakfast was great.  Not really the typical continental breakfast. They provided oatmeal packets AND they also have a 2 minute waffle maker that made great waffles!! Hubby had 2 servings! Kids were also delighted that the 11:00am checkout left time for a little swim after the pool opened at 10. Before

This Super 8 rated well in online reviews, and I was so pleased with this property!!  The room was comfortable, the beds weren't too soft or too hard, and the shower was just amazing! The hotel staff was very accommodating, even when I needed to add an extra day.  The wine and snacks in the evening was very welcome after a long day, and I enjoyed the opportunity to make new friends.  I will book this hotel again when I come back to town!

Summary Heading: I think the motel needs a thorough cleaning and updating...
Summary: I think the motel needs a thorough cleaning and updating.  Especially the beds and carpet.  The employee Pablo was an excellent part of out stay!

Edgar is a wonderful Manager and his team, Pablo, Irvin, * William are just so helpful & professional in every aspect. So is Mike who take cares of all of us outside if we need help, & Elizabeth to keeping all the rooms so clean. I can't say enough terrific things about Edgar & his team. You can tell Edgar really cares, and only hires the best. He's done a great job. The pool is really nice as well. I will always stay here when I come to town. Many thanks to Edgar for running a tight ship. You can tell his employees love their jobs, that starts at the top, with a boss like Edgar. Thank you for everything & everyone here. Sincerely, Sharon Kay Howard

The room was ok. Staff was helpful. They allowed us an early check in. The bed was not very comfortable. The pillow was hard and flat. Breakfast was satisfactory. Pool gate was locked early before closing time, but the ducks in the pool were enjoyable to watch. The people next door to us were dealing drugs, so there was a lot of noise going on all night. Good central location, not far from 405 freeway.
We stayed here for one night. It was a great value! The staff is nice and helpful.  The rooms are clean. There is a great Pub within walking distance. I would come back.

I visited my son and had to stay at an inexpensive motel. I stayed in the area 8 days. The motel room was clean and well kept. While I spent little time in the room I found the bed to be ok. The refrigerator and microwave in the room was helpful for an extended stay. Shopping in the area was convenient.  I could walk to supermarket and other shops. Breakfasts were uneventful but plentiful. The evening wine and chips were a pleasant occurrence. I will return to the area in a couple of months. I will probably stay there again.
This is a well used hotel. The rooms are clean, the furniture is a little worn. Bed edges were broken down, all in all not a bad place.

This is an older hotel as evidenced by ragged carpet, but it is kept up very well and the room was very large, and very clean.  Even the corners of the carpet where it meets the walls were clean, which is rare. Bed was adequate but sponge pillows a bit hard; the grounds are kept up well; staff professional and friendly; easy access in and out; plenty of eateries in the area.  I would recommend this hotel to anyone traveling in the area, and definitely stay at it again.

The room is surprisingly clean for a motel room comparing it to other super8 motels that i have stayed in. Edgar, the manager, was very friendly. checking in and out was quick. towels and room changes and cleaned daily. kmart, target and eateries are all about one/two blocks away. all attractions are about 15mins drive away. san diego is abt 45mins drive away. they truely deserve the tripadvisor award.

We stayed at a number of properties in the LA area and this was by far the best value.  Staff was very accommodating.  Provided in room microwave, turned on hot tub, heated pool was very comfortable even in the winter.  Free breakfast, snacks, and wifi. Quiet, clean property.

Large room, clean (no obvious filth or bugs!), inexpensive for the area. Convenient to PCH and beach towns; close to shopping and restaurants. No elevator, but ground floor rooms are drive- up. Uninspired breakfast, but you won't starve if you are not picky. I made do with OJ and an apple. I checked in at midnight and the clerk voluntarily extended my check-out time an hour *although I ended up staying 2 days).  Clerk had to come to room to get TV working, as someone messed with the box. They had a pool, but I am not sure if it was closed for the season--it looked clean thru the fence.
Very clean. Staff was great. I didn't expect much from this location but even though it was a one night stay it was very pleasant. Nice rooms great location.

Luckily I took heed of Tracy P. of Peoria's comment about taking her own pillow; I took my memory foam pillow.  The bedspreads were so slippery they ended up on the floor each morning.  I should have asked for extra blankets.  "Non-smoking" rooms means only in the room.  There are ashtrays right outside the doors and smoke from neighboring smokers wafted into our room at all hours of the day and night.  I am allergic to cigarette smoke.  There was a locked connecting door to the next room---I could hear much of the TV noise and conversation through the spaces around this door despite cramming the bottom with a blanket and two pillows.  For me, the mattress was too hard.  I used an inflatable camping mat atop the bed.  The telephone was not working.  I had to ask for shampoo and
The room wasn't very clean. Hair in the tub. Sheets had black marks on them. The beds were very uncomfortable and the pillows were extremely flat. The breakfast was pretty good.

Summary Heading: fun for me and the girls
Summary: I just got thru with a nasty divorce and i try at least once a month or every her weekend when i have my girls and stay a nite. They love the heated pool and the rooms we've have never had anything bad to say and always look forward for our little getaway

Summary Heading: I would not stay there again.
Summary: The bed sheet looks old and dirty also has holes in it. I found hairs on my bed  when I lift the pillow up which I believe that they did not change the bed sheet. Also  lots of dirty spots on the pillow cases. The refrigerator has a chewing gum on the top.
Manager Response: First and foremost, please accept our sincerest apologies for the very unsatisfactory experience you had at our property. Please rest assured that this is not the norm and we make every effort to take care of our guests. Thank you for bringing these matters to our attention, as the observations of our guests are an important part of how we can improve the quality of our service to our guests. I will be more than happy to review this further with you; you may reach me at (714) 545-9471.

Summary Heading: I enjoyed our say at Super 8. There was good quality...
Summary: I enjoyed our say at Super 8. There was good quality service by the manager at check in and check out. We had nice clean rooms, with very comfortable beds. The whole place was very clean, good landscaping. WE also enjoyed the continental breakfast as it had many varieties of items to choose from. Overall we enjoyed our time there and would highly recommend this hotel.

Summary Heading: My review was excellent. I would recommend this motel to my...
Summary: My review was excellent. I would recommend this motel to my friends and family. Please share this experence with others,  Thanks

Summary Heading: The only thing Super is the name!
Summary: I do not recommend this hotel. The shower was slow to drain as was the sink.  The toilet required hands on in order to refill the tank or to stop filling the tank.  The comforter had a huge dark stain.  Although, this was a "non" smoking room it continually reeked of smoke, no matter how much frebreze we used. The key coder was broken so we were only given one key that just happened to be precoded for our room, otherwise they were gonna go back and forth unlocking our door for the whole week we were there.
Manager Response: Please accept our sincerest apologies for the unsatisfactory stay you had at our property. I assure you that this is not typical of the service that we provide to our guests. Thank you for taking the time to provide us with your observations, as these constitute an integral part in helping us to improve our guest service. I also apologize for only having our back-up key available for your room, as these keys are made in advance in case of an emergency, such as the problem we encountered with our key encoder when you checked in.

Summary Heading: Older facility but clean. Paid extra for a whirlpool tub in...
